Reviews.Title: “Just around the corner from Barcelona Cathedral”
Reviews.Author: Andi-Rosevile
Reviews.Content: This great little hotel is literally a half block away from the Barcelona Cathedral. It should not be confused with the much larger and way more expensive Colon Hotel that is immediately adjacent to the Cathedral (and as a result is in a far noisier location). I have attached a picture that shows a view of the Regenica Colon hotel (its the building in the sun in the center of the picture), taken from the square in front of the Cathedral, so you can see how close it is to the Cathedral square). The Regencia was perfect in every way for us: an easy cab trip from the airport, perfectly situated and close to La Rambla, immaculately clean but non-fancy rooms, and a price that couldn't be beat. Staff was very helpful. We will definitely use this hotel again if we are able to return to Barcelona some day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RuthieS
Reviews.Content: We were very happy at this hotel. I see others have complained of the noise, but I asked for a quiet room on the 5th floor when making my reservation and got it. I think my room was 560. Our windows opened onto balconies and we could see the gothic cathedral but it was quiet at night. You couldn't ask for a better location. We walked to most everything--except the Sagrada Familia and Park Guell. Very convenient to metro. We did not buy the breakfast. We found a lot of excellent food right around the corner and a nice little bar just a couple of doors down from the entrance. Good wifi and bathroom. Room was a little warm, so I'm not sure how it would be in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: LainaKS
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the flowery and slightly dated decor, this hotel is really good. Fab location right next to the Cathedral and therefore, near to La Ramblas and Barri Gotic. Larger than average sized rooms in a European capital, comfortable beds, an easy to use safe, large, clean bathroom with a good shower too. Breakfast was good with plenty of choice including cereals, meats and cheeses, yoghurts, fruit and even scrambled eggs and bacon! The hotel staff are helpful and there is always someone there to give assistance - I asked for an extra blanket late in the evening and they got me one straight away. As many others have said about all Barcelona hotels, the TV channels were limited and there was street noise but nothing too bad at all. Just bring ear plugs. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good but loud”
Reviews.Author: PSEBoston
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Friendly staff and very clean. Our biggest problem with this hotel was the noise level coming from outside, especially on weekends. Even with the windows closed we could hear people outside throughout the night and we were on the 4th floor. The air conditioning had not been turned on resulting in a really warm room (we are not on the Barcelona temperature schedule). We think this would have been fine to stay at during the week for just a night or two but for a longer stay, during a weekend, we would recommend staying further from the action so you can sleep through the night.

Reviews.Title: “Good position”
Reviews.Author: patchworkpugit
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel as it was based in a very convenient location for all amenities. It is behind the Hotel Colon and just a short walk to the Gothic Cathedral. The hotel was spotlessly clean and very basic. Our room was the same as most hotels that I have stayed in before but very functional. It did seem to be bit noisy but what else can you expect in the busy area that the hotel is located. It didn't trouble us unduly. The breakfast was a buffet style and you could choose cereals and then you had scrambled eggs, bacon and little sausages. There was a toaster to use with choices of bread . There was also a selection of cold meats and fruits with yoghurts and croissants. It was a little samey after the first two days but at least it set you up for the day. There are loads of places to get coffees and snacks. Las Ramblas is only a few minutes walk through a little warren of streets with little shops. There is also a tourist bus which you can buy a 1 or 2 day ticket for. this takes you to all the tourist places on either the red, blue or green route. You get offat the stops and then get back on the next bus when you are ready. Sagrada Familia is fantastic and worth a visit. We then went to Park Guell where Guadi lived for 20 years and there is a museum there. The Casa Batllo is well worth a visti but may seem quite expensive but the building is amazing. We walked for miles but is worth the effort and there are some fantastic eateries. The main one we used was Choquitas on Las Ramblas and the waiters were very friendly. The best two were Estruch which is opposite the Gothic Cathedral just round the corner from the hotel. The food was excellent and good value for the portion size. The most relaxed one was at the port and is called the Celler de Tapas in Placa Universitat. Amazing food Would go again

Reviews.Title: “Great for Us”
Reviews.Author: dstorm6196
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel for its proximity to Catalunya and La Rambla. The room was larger than expected and included a sitting area. The bathroom was spacious. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel since we decided to try local cuisine. Nightlife is non-existent during the week. We were unseccessful in finding any places to hang out during the late hours. Victor was very helpful with tour suggestions. We added Montserrat and a flamenco show to our already full itinerary. Both are a must. The hop-on hop-off gave a great overview of Barcelona. We needed another day to take it all in. Overall, a great location and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not so good an experience!”
Reviews.Author: kanika_behl
Reviews.Content: Travelled in mid march and booked the hotel while on the end of our journey. Read great reviews of this hotel, but it was nothing close. While booking had requested for a twin share bed, as most of the double beds in Spain are small for 2 adults and a child (3 years old). But never got what we asked for, it was a small double bed, seemed like we were staying right on the road, could feel the hustle bustle of barcelona until 4 am, after which we managed to sleep. The rooms are so close that u feel someone is constantly knocking on yr door, though it's the next door! Else... Good points..I guess the location is very good in the heart of Bari gothic, good view of the cathedral and minutes of walk from la rambla. But I guess there are more hotels around to try.

Reviews.Title: “Location and cleanliness”
Reviews.Author: mansson_preacher
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location! The hotel is located in the heart of Barca, near the Cathedral. A perfect price-value combination.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: Morten J
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a perfect location, close to Las Ramblas, Plaza Catalunya and the Gothic area. You are in the middle of everything :) The size of the rooms are bigger than you expect from the price, and very nice. Good beds, if you don't like soft beds. Nice breakfast, and very helpful staff. Very good value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable and easily reached by foot from the airport bus at Plaza Catalunya. Short walking distance to Las Ramblas, port area and historic centre. Quiet. Good service from reception staff and nice breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadwith4
Reviews.Content: How about being across the plaza from the Barcelona Gothic Cathedral and a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas and a 10 minute cab ride to the the Port of Barcelona. The location of Regencia Colon Hotel was perfect. But it gets better; the rooms were spacious and airy , the bathroom had all the modern conveniences including their own toiletries. Wonderful breakfast with both hot and cold foods. But the best of all was the night clerk, Pedro! This guy was like our private travel guide. He not only made recommendations as to where to eat Christmas Day he called each restaurant to get a reservation and to ask about the price. He called cabs and asked them to not turn on the meter until everyone in our party of 9 was present. While we did not see much of Barcelona because everything was closed for the Christmas holiday, Pedro made our stay enjoyable. He may be the best asset the hotel has!We don't speak Spanish but his English was a life saver.

Reviews.Title: “Better value than it's namesake next door!”
Reviews.Author: lome1977
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Regencia Colon is NOT the same hotel as the Hotel colon. THey ARE both right on the plaza with the cathedral though. Thie Regencia is right behins the Hotel Colon but it is much cheaper. This is because the room s are smaller and there are nor great views from your room windows...but who comes to Barcelona to stay in their room? My wife and I were here for a week at christmas and it was a GREAT!! value for the location We would definitley stay here again. The beds are traditionally european so they are two single beds pushed together and tend to be a little stiffer than in the States.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Jenine C
Reviews.Content: Everything about HRC was perfection! My husband and I spent the first 5 days/4 nights of our honeymoon in Barcelona. We were both pleased with our hotel. The room was spacious and it was serviced daily. The best part of this hotel is the location! It's close enough to everything without being right in the mix. The area is very safe, not sketchy at all and not in place full of tourists like right in Las Ramblas. We were less than a 10 minute walk to Las Ramblas, less than 30 minute walk to the Picasso museum. There are lots of cafes very close by and a delicious taparia down the street. Also, there was a US bank ATM near by which made things very convenient for us. The staff were friendly, helpful and professional. Another detail we loved; before you leave for the day you drop your room key at the front desk then pick it up when you return. This is nice so you don't have to worry about losing it while you're wondering around the beautiful city. When/if we go back to Barcelona, we'll definitely be staying at Hotel Regencia Colon!

Reviews.Title: “Good value; great location”
Reviews.Author: SB1114
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days, and were very satisfied. The hotel clerk recommended Room 261, which has a huge outdoor patio. As far as we could tell, this is the only room with any kind of outdoor area. The location is very good; walking distance to most tourist areas. We previously had stayed at the Hotel Colon right on the plaza. This hotel was less expensive, and the cathedral was under restoration anyways.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location, but the noise!”
Reviews.Author: traveler30
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the location of this hotel is excellent. We could walk to just about everything. (One note, there is a little market in the side street next to it that we didn't find until the last day. Very handy when you know). Staff was not overly friendly, but about normal for Barcelona. The bad side was the street noise, even though the hotel is on what seems like a deserted small street. It was like once an hour all night long there was an epic battle between a garbage truck and a bulldozer. Not sure who won - but I lost a lot of sleep! If it was quieter, this would be a dream hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel experience of my life!”
Reviews.Author: danimary
Reviews.Content: While there are many good mthings to say about this hotel, the simple fact is, if you can't sleep because of the noise, the best location and friendly staff don't really matter in the end. Garbage collection during the wee hours of the morning...every morning. 3 am our second night was the recyclable collection. The sound of smashing glass at that time of day is not conducive to sleep. The ac is turned off by November so closing the window meant a stflingly hot room and opening the window left us susceptible to every noise from the street. The location was great though for those of you who can sleep through the warfare being waged by the garbage collectors every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: mobilemills
Reviews.Content: We booked the Regencia Colon based upon the moderate price. To our surprise the location and service surpassed our expectations. An older, smaller hotel we found to be clean with spacious rooms that was within walking distance to many of the the cities Gothic Quarter focal points. Just a "block" from a major hop-on-hop off stop we were srategically located to see all the sights. We were a bit disappointed in the breakfast (not included and a bit expensive for the offering) but soon found locations close by that met our needs. The Barcelona Cathedral Plaza was in view from our window and the music, dancing and other activities that took place there were delightful. We lost our hearts to this beautiful city and plan a return trip. We will definitely returin to the Regencia Colon and have already recommended it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Oh that sewer smell”
Reviews.Author: Rod & Vicky
Reviews.Content: I, mistakenly, booked the Regencia Colon instead of the Hotel Colon. They are adjacent to each other and both owned by the same company BUT the rooms at the Regencia were half the size but not half the price (135 Euros versus 150 Euros). Location was still great but for ice you had to go next door to the Colon and oh that sewer gas smell in the bathroom-YIKE. We tried putting the plugs in the bidet, tub and sink but that was only marginally effective. They did have Wi-Fi but didn’t advertise it so we spent time in McD’s the first day.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: UllaCph
Reviews.Content: Perfect location in the middle of everything. The staff at the front desk were very helpful, but at breakfast (which was not cheap), the waiter wouldn't accept two people to sit at the good, big tables with tableclothes, but commanded them to move to the small and bad tables. The good tables were marked as "reserved" every day, but we never saw more than one or two of them occupied. The room was spacious and clean, and the bathroom was nice. Just one advice; Don't use the body lotion at the bathroom - you wil stink like a coconut all day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MBAX01
Reviews.Content: We were a little ambivalent when we arrived at the hotel..(not being familiar with the city) but were very pleasantly surprised when we saw the room and saw the location. The Gothic Quarter of Barcelona is the best part of the city to see….it’s very walkable and there is something interesting to see down every street and around every corner. The Regencia is perfectly located to explore the Gothic…..about 100 feet from the plaza where the Barcelona Cathedral (this is NOT the Gaudi Cathedral) is situated and about a 10 minute walk from the Plaza Catalunya. The Cathedral is in the oldest part of the city.....there are remnants of the Roman aqueduct and the Roman city wall in the plaza The room was a good size (for a European hotel), the bathroom was quite useable, the elevator fit 4 people (without luggage), and the front desk staff was great. The only negatives were the lack of a bar and restaurant in the hotel but don’t go nuts over this…the Bisbe Taverna is a 3 minute walk from the hotel across the plaza and you can get breakfast (coffee, a half-baguette hot or cold sandwich (with ham, bacon, sausage, cheese, or egg) for about 3 Euro (about the price of breakfast in a US Diner) and there are lots of small and large indoor and outdoor bars and restaurants ranging from reasonable to pricey within close walking distance. The room had 2 twin beds (not the best….or the worst for softness), a desk, closet with drawers, 2 small chairs, good reading lamps above the bed, and air conditioning that the guest controls and is capable of keeping beer cold in the room. The Wi-Fi worked well and was FREE. The cleaning staff did an excellent job every day and the room was spotless. If you open the window at nigh there is a good deal of street noise so keep it closed and use the A/C

Reviews.Title: “Serviceable and adequate”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaLew
Reviews.Content: This was a good but very basic hotel, in a great location, right in the Gothic Quarter, in a pretty safe part of that quarter. It’s definitely a 3-star hotel. The room was brightly lit. There was some outside noise—the church bells chiming every hour and a hostel/bar next door that made some noise—but my wife was able to sleep fine with ear plugs. The towels, bed, and pillows were all pretty tired. The room safe had no instructions, so I had to ask the man at the desk, and he had to write out the instructions. That seemed pretty lame. Also, the wall safe was so small, that we could barely fit our iPad in it, and even then had to jury rig it by tipping it upward with some socks. The room did not have a clock, face cloths, or tissues, but this was true of almost everywhere we stayed in Spain, so I don’t hold that against them. But if you don’t like to rely on wake up calls, bring an alarm clock. The bathroom didn’t even have an extra roll of toilet paper. Note this hotel is different from the Hotel Colon, although the two have similar websites, and are next to each other. Indeed, some of the pictures posted by reviewers are actually of the Hotel Colon. After staying here five nights, we were due to come back for one additional night at the end of our trip. Instead, we cancelled and booked at the Hotel Colon, which was only 10 or 15 euros more, and it was definitely worth it. You can also see my review of that hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ken k
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were excellent, and the location was outstanding, after one half day I had my bearings and could not have been in a better location. The hotel was of good quality and I highly recomend it. We got there too early to check in and the hotel let us leave our luggage in a secure area so we could go out and see the sights. We will definetely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great value...we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Pat S
Reviews.Content: My two sisters and I spent three nights at the hotel. It worked perfectly for us. We had a spacious room with three separate beds (not easy to find), and the personnel at the hotel were very helpful. The location was great, being close enough to walk to Las Ramblas, but far enough away to avoid the crowds and noise. I would highly recommend this hotel, and feel it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, helpiful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Alison127
Reviews.Content: We (a family of 5) stayed here for one night only but it was a very pleasent experience. We had a double and also a triple room. The beds were very comfortable. Both rooms were of a nice size with pleasant decor.The air conditioning was a little noisy but I was the only one out of the five of us that noticed it. The breakfast was really good and served in a lovely dining room. The outstanding thing about this hotel was the staff. We meet three members of front desk staff at various times during our stay and each one was equally professional, helpiful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Thea1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location right in front of the cathedral and near shopping and restaurants. Quiet, clean, delicious breakfast. A good value for the price. We'd stay here again. We used the bus system to get around the city and had no problems. It was cheap and easy. We met 2 people who'd had something stolen from them. One woman had her purse stolen off the back of her chair at a restaurant, and another man had his wallet stolen in the subway. Barcelona is a beautiful, unique city. We stayed there on a Friday and Saturday night. We were on the 2nd floor but it wasn't too loud. I used earplugs and had no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UNCfanVal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great central location and close to most of the sites you would want to visit. It's a street behind the plaza with the Barcelona Cathedral. The hotel staff was very friendly, helpful, and spoke English. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived and they held our luggage for us. They also gave us a map and said we should walk around the Barri Gotic, La Rambla, and down by the port on our first day. We did just that and it worked out perfectly. The next day we took the Hop On Hop Off Site Seeing Bus. If you buy the tickets at the hotel you get a cheaper price and a large coupon book. We were leaving at 5am for a flight to Amsterdam and they made sure a cab was waiting for us. The room was large and the beds were the typical hard beds in Europe. We had a triple room on the side of the hotel and our bathroom was really narrow and cramped. From the map on the room door it didn't seem any of the other bathrooms were as small. It's just the angle our room was at. We did get a lot of noise at night because the hostel was opposite our room. If your room isn't on that side it's probably not noisy as noisy. The hotel also has free wifi you just have to ask for the password. The tv gets CNN, BBC News and Disney in English. The breakfast was pretty much your standard European breakfast spread. Now back to the location. It couldn't be better. It's about a 5-10 min walk to La Rambla, Placa Catalunya, Port Vell, and Parc de la Ciutadella. The Hop On Hop Off bus has a stop across the street from the Cathedral plaza. There are also a lot of restaurants nearby. We took a day trip out to do the Freixenet Cava tour. You can catch the train at the Placa Catalunya station out there for 3 Euro. The ride is about 40 min. That way you don't have to take the metro to the main train station and then go from there. People had mentioned how bad the pickpocketing was. We left our passports and any money we didn't think we'd use in the safe in the room. We were aware of our surroundings and held onto our purses. We didn't have any issues.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: BeachipichiNJ
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Barcelona in three years, and, by far, a much more pleasant experience than the last time. For starters, we stayed at the Hotel Regencia Colon, which was located one block from the Barcelona Cathedral. The hotel is clean, modern, centrally located near the Liceu Metro stop, and very quiet. The hotel staff was courteous (I won’t say friendly because I don’t think that’s possible in Barcelona, especially towards Americans) and helpful. In general, we did not encounter the rudeness and hostility that was ever present on my last trip. We visited the Sagrada Familia and saw the incredibly beautiful and completed interior of the church. A nice improvement from three years ago is you now pay for your elevator ticket along with your entrance fee and you are given a choice of taking the elevator up and down. In the past, taking the elevator down was not an option, and an unwelcome surprise for visitors who had to make the trek down the scary spiral stairs. When visiting Sagrada Familia be sure to arrive when it opens at 9 a.m. otherwise you’ll waste a lot of time waiting in line to enter. Also, allow 3-4 hours so you’re sure to see everything. No visit to Barcelona is complete without eating at least once at the Mercado de la Boqueria. If you love markets, you will love the Boqueria. At the market you will find the freshest fruit, bocadillos (bocattas), and seafood in Barcelona, and it is the cheapest place to eat. For example, one morning my husband and I each had a fresh fruit salad, a large bocatta, and a coffee for 11 euros (total). The Boqueria is my favorite eatery in Barcelona and I will miss it. Getting around Barcelona is so easy. The metro system is great and cheap—a T-10 card costs around 8 euros and can be shared. However, I think you’ll find that you may prefer to walk because the sights are all so close to each other and if you’re underground you’ll miss the art and architecture that fills the city (we’re not fans of buses so we tend to avoid those, when possible). One last comment, be wary of pickpockets and bag thieves. We didn’t have a problem, but we heard the frantic screams of a woman who had placed her bag down for a moment only to have it disappear in an instant. A woman should never, ever, take her bag off of her lap in a restaurant and a man should wear a wallet that is chained to his belt. This piece of advice applies to any major city.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great price.”
Reviews.Author: AB34678
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very basic but had all necessities. Perfect location. Most sights within walking distance or accessible by nearby metro. Extremely helpful staff. Great for a stop over before boarding cruise. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: eimalibu
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located right in the heart of the gothic quarter, on the doorstep of La Cathedral. It is ideally located to explore Barcelona, with buses and the metro only a few minutes away. The staff in the hotel were very friendly with good English. The hotel was clean and very well kept. MInibar and safes in the room. If I was too mention any negatives it would be that our minibar was not restocked at all during our stay and the area tended to be quite noisy early in the morning with bins being emptied. These were minor negatives really though as our stay was very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: biggatorfan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literally right across the street from La Catedral, convenient to the subway/La Rambla/Museu Picasso/Palau de la Musica Catalana/Esglesia de Santa Maria del Mar/etc., and the tourist buses if you choose to do that. The rooms were clean and neat. The room was quiet at night until early am (maybe 6 or so), when you can hear some motorcycle traffic (there is a lot of motorcycle parking near La Catedral). 3 of the 4 of us didn't notice. I think there might have been an issue with the AC in one of our rooms, but the weather was nice and really didn't need it. They charge one euro per page if you want to use their printer :( Overall, we were quite happy with this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: saoakman
Reviews.Content: Clean, safe, very classy and helpful staff. The location next to the cathedral makes this a great location for exploring the city, whether on foot or by Metro, but I think it's quieter than las Ramblas. Lots of attractions and restaurants nearby, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous111213
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Regencia Colon for five nights in May, 2011. The hotel staff was outstanding. They were always ready to assist with directions, suggestions, book tickets. etc. The front desk staff spoke English - helpful for me. The room was sufficently large for two people to live in without discomfort. The room and bathroom were very clean. The only complaint I would have about the room, and it's minor, is that the bathroom floor gets very wet when taking a shower because the shower door encloses just 1/2 the shower. The location of the hotel accross the street from the Cathedral in the Gothic Quarter was very convenient. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “classic hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 2kitty2
Reviews.Content: classic European hotel, very nice staff, my neck pillow was sent to laundry with sheets and it was returned to me in perfect condition, very nice service. central location with wonderful, reasonable places to eat up the little block, the best pizza, fun bars. be careful many pick pockets and theifs get in your face, ok but mind youself.

Reviews.Title: “Noise at weekends”
Reviews.Author: Ian_Stanworth
Reviews.Content: Sad to say there was one big flaw with this place - terrible noise from the street at weekends. Room was fine, clean and comfortable with good bathroom, plenty of space and comfortable bed. Staff were also fine. Location seemed great - 10 min walk from Place De Catalunya and right in the heart of the Barri Gotic by the Cathedral. Friday night - quite a bit of noise from outside throughout the night. Saturday night - just terrible. Almost no sleep even with earplugs in. Constant stream of very noisy people from hostel about 10 yards across the road - singing, screaming, shouting, playing football against the wall at 3 in the morning!! Sunday night was OK Not a lot the hotel can do about it but still can't recommend people stay here because of this issue It's a shame because everything else was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: summerlea45
Reviews.Content: The picture shown is of the main Hotel just in front of the Regencia which is in a side road behind - no views of the Cathedral BUT much quieter than the square would be - there is some traffic noise but nothindg serious - Church clock - chimes. Found the staff very helpful even if not gushing- multilingual and dealt with all the q's well. Breakfast in bright room, basic but more than adequate, Eggs bread, cheese , meats juices... Rooms not palacial but very clean and fine for a short stay - NO electric kettle. Location excellent - 2 mins to Tour Buses, Very good local market 200 yards (St Caterina). Cathedral and Old Town 2 mins - Jaume 1 (Underground) an easy 10 mins - Theater de Musica de Catalana ( 5 mins) Cortez de Inglisi (Huge Departmental Store (10 mins) - would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gofrogs817
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here for 3 nights and absolutely loved this hotel. The room was spacious for Europe with it's own sitting area and had free Wifi. The location could not have been better. It was right in the heart of the historic city center and about a 7-8 walk to the place to Catalunya and public transportation. The staff was friendly and helpful and everything worked out perfectly. I booked directly from the hotel's website and breakfast was available for an additional cost. It would be nice to be included but there are several options very close by if you opt out. Overall, the perfect hotel from which to explore Barcelona. When we return, we will be staying there again, no doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect valu”
Reviews.Author: RomaGiorgio
Reviews.Content: Clean (we stayed with a 4 year old child), very very central, large room, right price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: polly1996
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights pre cruise holiday. We were impressed with the reception and breakfast room staff. The bedroom was clean, comfortable and adequate size. The bathroom was quite spacious but cold. Maybe it was because we were on the 5th floor but we were not disturbed by street noise. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: ItalyRocky
Reviews.Content: This was our hotel after a 12 day cruise. We were booked for Christmas Eve and Christmas Day Eve. The hotel is in a superb location; close to Metro, sights, food, Las Ramblas, etc. The staff was very professional and helpful. The hotel itself is a little dated. They have a partner hotel across the street that is more high end and the price reflects that. If you want a good hotel, for an average price, in a great location . . .this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location close to everything, great staff, huge room, good internet, very clean.”
Reviews.Author: mel_warren1
Reviews.Content: The staff gave us plenty of information on the whole city, and helped us figure out transport including calling the train station when we wanted to go to a theme park. The room was very big, had a fridge and was very clean. Was great for me because I have allergies, the room had floor boards which really helped. Electric blinds blocked out the light. Make sure you check the fridge, there was an open bottle in there, staff were great when we let them know straight away and they didn't charge us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Front Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: bonnetta
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Regencia Colon for three days before our cruise left Barcelona. We arrived from the United States at 10:00 in the morning and we were allowed to check in to our room upon arrival, which was a big plus as we were worn out. The front desk staff bent over backwards to be helpful; i.e., sightseeing, restaurants, etc. We couldn't have asked for anything more and the price was a bargain for such a great location. There was a bit of noise from the street, but nothing that prevented us from getting a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice hotel for an average price”
Reviews.Author: del_lover
Reviews.Content: Linia A2 The previous person said: "How can a 3 star rated hotel not have ice, air conditioning (hotel turned off), vending machines, or breakfast buffet that does not open before 7am? We had to leave earlier in the morning just to get breakfast at the airport. Each day we had to go across the street to get our ice at their sister hotel. No one to help with your bags (no valet) and you have to carry your bags up a stairway to get in & out of the hotel (bad for anyone with a disability). By America standards, this is barely a 2 star, maybe 1 1/2 star. Also, because we had to leave the window open it was too noisey to sleep as people party until 5am here. Only good thing------super location. " Here is what I think of this opinion and my opinion on the hotel as well: - The hotel has air conditioners. We were in the hotel on 15-th of Novermber 2010 and have stayed for 3 nights. In the corridor it was so hot compared to the weather outside (14 degrees C) that we did not needed air conditioning. - You need the buffet breakfast to open before 7 am, wow? The museums in Barcelona open at 10:00 am usually, La Rambla's stores and restaurants stay opened even after at 24:00. This is not Vienna, where most stores and restaurants are closed at 18:00 o'clock. Do you have any store in your neighborhood that opens prior to 7:00 am, but is not working non-stop? I would never get out of bed before 9:00am when I am for a leisure trip, except if I am to catch my flight/train/bus early. I cannot believe that you haven't prepared in advance for this event. And do you need to eat before 7:00 am seriously? I am not hungry at this time ever. Have you actually thought that the other countries around the World, might not have your breafast schedule? - Why do you need ice (uh and in November)?! I don't know if you have heard, but this is not an all-exclusive hotel, is it? I would usually get the ice with my beer, and probably I will take that in one of the restaurants around the hotel. I am wondering how these people have managed to remain calm and provide you with what you need from their sister hotel. In the end, why didn't you rebooked and took the other hotel? - I am wondering how are you going to reach into the airport or explore the city if you do not have the strength to move your luggage some 10 steps up or down. The elevator of the hotel works for the rest. I would advice you not to go to Europe any more - we have hotels with more than 300 steps - it could cost your life to reach the hotel. There are lots of hotels without elevators. - Let me know, which American hotel in the heart of New York would cost me some close to the price for this hotel and compare it. The rooms were very very tidy, and what you have there in the rooms is really nice! I have been in Italy, France, Austria, Germany, Monaco, Slovakia, Romania, Albania, Bulgaria, Switzerland in 2 or 3 star hotels and only one of the six 3 star hotels in Switzerland (Bristol in Zurich), is comparable to this one. The lady that cleans the rooms is perfect, the furniture is perfect, they have an LCD with maybe 100+ channels but I really do not care about TV (my girl listens to music, hence I skipped more than 100 channels to find one). - The location of the hotel is superb. I always choose the best locations before I choose a hotel. - This hotel is noisy - and I knew that before I have visited the hotel. There are two things a man can do about this usually - to get a room which is more quite than the other rooms (I got our room on the last floor), and to put something in his ears. Of course you decided to open the window of the room, so that it noisier to you - cool! And the noisy there is not from parties around - they are simply cleaning up the streets at 1-2am night (yes, it is a clean area). - What my girl and I need from a hotel: - Good location - Good sleep - Good service - Clean hotel - Comfortable room The only true con of this hotel is the noise. By the way the receptionsts are nice, and make nice jokes. It wasn't a problem to leave our luggage in the hotel for many hours after we checked out, or to check out with some delay. We also got a free map, some nice tips for newbies to Barcelona, a large room for 3 (we have paid for a double room) And my girl is really thankful to the lady that is cleaning the rooms every day - my girl is pedantic when it comes to cleaning. If you use a towel - the lady will change it the next day, something that they did not do neither in Zurich, Bern or Geneva - three of the most expensive cities in the World. Have some nice time in Barcelona, definetly choose a hotel in Barry Gotic and if you your pocket matches this hotel - choose it. If you have more time to prepare or if you are more people, an apartment could do a great job too I trust. Don't choose a hotel on La Rambla... I would expect it to be very noisy if the room has a view to the street.

Reviews.Title: “No Ice!”
Reviews.Author: BORFDayton_Oh
Reviews.Content: How can a 3 star rated hotel not have ice, air conditioning (hotel turned off), vending machines, or breakfast buffet that does not open before 7am? We had to leave earlier in the morning just to get breakfast at the airport. Each day we had to go across the street to get our ice at their sister hotel. No one to help with your bags (no valet) and you have to carry your bags up a stairway to get in & out of the hotel (bad for anyone with a disability). By America standards, this is barely a 2 star, maybe 1 1/2 star. Also, because we had to leave the window open it was too noisey to sleep as people party until 5am here. Only good thing------super location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if it's "between seasons".”
Reviews.Author: LALady16
Reviews.Content: Our room was UNBEARABLY hot. Front desk said the air conditioning had been turned off for seasonal reasons. In other words, it doesn't matter what the temperature is outside, the air conditioning is turned off on a certain date. Had to sleep with window open; still very hot and impossible to sleep due to noisy area. On second day it felt as if heater was on. Maintenance person showed us switches to control it. From what we gathered, there will be either heat or air conditioning, depending on the date, not the weather. It's a shame we can't recommend it, as the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was clean and the hotel was in a good location. The management really needs to reconsider the timing of the air conditioning and heating.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: BcIntrepid
Reviews.Content: Though part of the same operation, the Regencia Colon is smaller, less luxurious and less expensive than the Colon, directly across the street. For the price, the Regencia Colon is a great deal in my opinion; the rooms and lobby are clean, the staff is friendly, multi-lingual and so helpful it was like having a tourist office in reception. The location can't be overstated; in the heart of the Gothic Quarter, 5 min walk from La Rambla and Placa Catalunya. Battlo, Mila and Sagrada Familia are all very walkable but for those disinclined, public transit is very close. You could eat out every day for 2 months and not hit every bar and restaurant within a 10 min walk of the Regencia. Anyone willing to sacrifice luxury for price could do much much worse than the Regencia Colon. Only a few warnings; first, it's been mentioned in a few reviews that this hotel can be a bit noisy, it is. Unfortunately it's not well sound-proofed and Barcelona is not a quiet place. Might be bothersome to light sleepers. Second, our room was very small by North American standards, it was a little cramped for 2 people with 3 weeks worth of luggage. Very minor inconvenience though, nothing more. Last, wireless internet is really spotty in Barcelona in general and basically didn't work at all in the hotel. The wifi at the Colon is free but a very poor signal. Again, not a major incovenience but for someone who uses the internet a lot while travelling, an inconvenience nonetheless. I won't give this hotel any more than 4 stars for the reasons listed above but that said, I'd stay here again in a minute - value for the money is definitely there.

Reviews.Title: “ATTENTION: Very costly breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Fanfan00799
Reviews.Content: Everything indicates that the breakfast is included in the room cost: nowhere is any mention of the very hight price of the breakfast! Because of the great location, the Regencia Colon could have been recommended even if the decor is so so, even if the water pressure is bad in the shower, even if the towels are gray and rough, even if there is no Internet station, IF the very HIGH RRICE of the breakfast.had not been added to the room cost.

Reviews.Title: “5 Day City Break in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: RLOrmskirk
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a five day break, flying in with Easyjet. We decided to use the frequent bus service from the airport which drops you off 10 mins walk from the hotel. The room while not spacious was excellently presented and very comfortable. The double bed was firm but we both slept well. There was an in-room safe which we used and a fridge with mini bar. The staff were very helpful, when we arrived we were given advice on keeping safe in Barcelona. We had no problems with pickpockets ourselves but always made sure to keep aware of our surroundings. The staff's recommendations for restaurants are also very worthy of note if you like Catalonian cuisine. Definitely avoid La Rambla tourtist traps, you can pay through the nose for very little. Transport is never a problem with tourist buses constantly circling the city, bike hire available and most destinations within walking distance. To summise, the staff call their hotel "the best located hotel in Barcelona", we certainly wouldn't argue with this. If you want to stay centrally in Barcelona, in a affordable, comfortable room with very friendly staff we couldn't recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, decent location”
Reviews.Author: AmandaLenhart
Reviews.Content: The room was large and comfortable. This hotel is about fifty feet from the cathedral and the piazza, but you have to walk at least ten minutes to Las Ramblas and the metro stop. We ordered a wake up call and taxi in order to catch an early morning flight. We never got the call. Thankfully my husband set an alarm on his cell phone. We walked downstairs to find there was no taxi, and the frond desk man was sleeping. Thankfully a taxi was able to get there quickly and we made our flight. Bring your own alarm!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Rebi2010
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Barcelona and we wanted to stay in the Barri Gotic area again - this hotel provided a fantastic deal although we were initially wary of the quality of the hotel. Our expectations were exceeded when we checked-in to our fifth floor room. The room was large with lots of storage space and the bathroom included a bath and shower (although water pressure was a bit random!) . Yes, it wasn't as modern as we have stayed in and the decor left a little to be desired but overall it was clean, quiet and cool (air conditioning is a must). The location was excellent providing a good base to see all of the sights: everything was within easy walking distance (Placa Catalunya 10 mins; La Ramblas 5 mins; Port Vell/Barcelonetta 10-15 mins). Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- Not too Loud”
Reviews.Author: NZam0
Reviews.Content: For a tourist class hotel it was very good. We booked a three person room. It faced Carerr del Doctor Joaquim on the 4th floor and windows provided plenty of light and was very clean (room 460). The airconditioner kept the room very cool and we would turn it off at night so our daughter would not get too cold. There were metal shades that rolled down with the touch of a switch and blocked out all light, which made sleeping easy. Like other reviews, we did not find the sound of the Cathederal bells to disturb our sleep. The bathroom was a bigger than most for this class of hotel, and the water pressure and hot water were very good. The location is excellent, with the Cathederal Plaza being nearby, the Bus Turistic stop about a three minute walk away, with many cafes and shops located around the plaza. We walked to the beach from the hotel, and it is quite a distance but the different passageways through the city are very interesting. We did not eat breakfast in the hotel, but opted to grab a coffee and pastries in one of the cafes or coffee shops nearby (my wife and daugter are not big breakfast eaters, so the 12 euro/person cost did not warrant eating at the hotel). The reception people were very nice and spoke to us in English. They were helpful and offered advice regarding sightseeing and getting around Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable rooms, friendly staff and great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: yviswanath
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel. The reception deask staff was very helpful. The room was very comfortable with a/c working well. The breakfast spread and choice was excellent. The location of the hotel near major attractions like the Cathedral were wonderful to allow for easy walking to see things. We will return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good service and location”
Reviews.Author: Roinila
Reviews.Content: Spending a week in Barcelona is a good start for exploring this wonderful city. We selected our hotel after spending couple of days reading Tripadvisors articles. Again we did got a good choise - Regencial Colon Hotel - just in the middle of the old city. Just minutes by foot from Las Ramblas and many of the museums and if you like music Palau de la Musica Catalana. This area is full of restaurants, shops and life. We rented a car for couple of days and it was very convenient that our hotel has a contract with the parking situated under the Cathedral Square. You pay only 20€ per day including unlimited amount of outgoings - note you have to ask first that from your hotel reception - otherwise you pay over 2€ per hour ! This parking has the best facilities and is easiest to drive in/out. The staff really wants to help you so don´t hesitate to ask. We got our problems solved everytime - Great ! They all seem to speak good English. Our room was normal size with roomy bathroom. All the premises were very clean and aircondition worked well, maybe bit noisy if you like cool room. We used the mildest no 1 position out of three. Only thing that needs your extra care is thiefs - they are clever. Keep an eye of your bags and do not leave them unattended. My wife lost her purse in Starbucks nearby - it was in her bag but unluckily leaned from backside of the chair. I would recommend this hotel to my friends because of good service and location. Will definitinely come back again !

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to a friend”
Reviews.Author: easygoinghoney
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Regencia Colon in February and had managed to find a relatively cheap deal online so we were not expecting much. We were extremely lucky that the weekend we were there was the only warm and sunny weekend in between weeks of snowy freezing temperatures. Upon checking in to the hotel, the receptionist was very helpful providing maps and giving info re bus tours etc. We had booked a B&B deal although the receptionist was convinced that breakfast had not been included in the rate until I managed to find the booking confirmation. The hotel room was small but comfortable with two single beds a small dressing table and wardrobe. The bathroom was clean and spacious with a power shower. The bathroom led out to the balcony with a view of the cathedral to one side. We were very lucky to get the only room with a balcony and assume this was just because it was low season. The windows were not double glazed and had a pull down shutter on the exterior, there was a little noise at night as the window of our room overlooked the side room which led on to Via Laietana which is one of Barcelona's busiest throroughfares so perhaps best to take a pair of ear plugs if travelling in the summer. I do not recall whether the room was air conditioned as, given the time of year we went, we did not have use of it. The breakfast was a continental buffet with a good selection of with the usual cooked meats, fruit, yoghurt and coffee. In terms of location, the hotel is brilliantly placed, close to all the action, tourist hot spots, beach, harbour, cathedral and public transport with two metro stops only a short walk away. The metro system is one of the most efficient that I have encountered thus far and always on time. All in all a very good deal considering the prices generally in Barcelona; which can be significant. The hotel was very good value for money and I would deifnitely recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value”
Reviews.Author: GinClub
Reviews.Content: fantastic value for money for its location . Close by foot for lots of attractions especially marina area and beaches. Ramblas close and good metro links. An old fashioned hotel with good old fashioned service. Make sure you you get cable cars from beach to Montjuiic. Fantastic views over whole city with fabulous bar at the end of ride for views and cold cocktail.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SK99NewJersey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights pre-cruise. We loved it. Our room #561 was spacious comfortable, clean and quiet. I think being on the 5th floor helped, also our bathroom window was facing noisy street, but as long as door was closed at night, it was quiet. Reading from the previous reviews about thin walls and noise, I guess we had quiet neighbors. Locations is great, close walk to everything, We had breakfast included, in my opinion it was very basic and it was not worth 12 euro per person, although it saved us time in the morning, next time I would not pay for it, I'd eat outside. Hotel stuff was very nice and helpful. I would stay here again or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a MUST STAY for a complete experience”
Reviews.Author: sporti7
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this place. I wouldnt have wanted to stay right on La Ramblas but this still is oh so close. Its even a one min walk away from the Blue line tourist bus stop outside Starbucks. We stayed here for 4 nights. Tthe rooms are brilliant for the price we paid. brilliant space, good view, clean, room service, everything works ! the staff was so pleasant and helpful. esp. Vincent at the reception. basically. if i go back to barcelona on the same budget. i am checking into Regencia Colon.

Reviews.Title: “Good all rounder”
Reviews.Author: Neveroddnoreven
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located - 5 mins walk to the harbour and 5 minutes walk from la Ramblas. For the price I thought this hotel provided good value. Yes it's a bit basic and the rooms are quite poorly soundproofed but you are paying under 100 Euros (with breakfast) to stay in the centre of Barcelona. Hotel is also very clean and the reception staff were friendly and polite. For a great pizza try the Italian restaurant just behind the hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Mommu
Reviews.Content: Nice,clean, spacious rooms . Located closer to all including Metro, Las Ramblas, great food, harbor, Picasso Museum etc....VERY NOISY AT NIGHT. Don't bother with breakfast here, very pricey, Go to La Boqueria Market( 5 minute walk). Night time staff was extremely helpful with reservations, recommendations & tracking lost luggage.No internet service at all,must go across street to sister hotel BEWARE PICK-POCKETS, THEY ARE EVERYWHERE. FRONT DESK HAS LIST OF PHONE NUMBERS TO NOTIFY CREDIT CARD COMPANIES ETC...............

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: walter13Antwerp
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel : location (near Cathedral) is perfect - price is ok - breakfast gives a good choise - the room was very clean and good space and the staff was very helpfull and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sparklintan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in mid march with one of my friends. We booked this hotel based on the price, location, and reviews on here. I must say the reviews have been pretty accurate. We requested 2 twin beds and we did receive 2 twin beds pushed together which was fine by us. The room was a tad smaller than American standards but its Europe and I didnt expect much larger. It was clean and comfortable so that was alright by me for the price we paid. The bathroom on the other hand was tiny. The only real complaint I have about it was that some of the toiletries were used and placed back in the basket on the sink. I took them out and set them aside and the cleaner replaced them the next day. Overall, the bathroom was clean and there was hot water so it worked for me. I must admit, I booked this hotel already knowing what others were saying that the walls were really paper thin and they were right. Thankfully I can sleep through a lot but my friend that I was traveling with was up almost all night because of the excessive noise outside and from the room next door. If you are a light sleeper this isnt the hotel for you. If you can handle a little noise, then I have no problem recommending it. The location was absolutely fabulous. We were within walking distance to most of the major sights and the hop on hop off bus picked up right outside the square. I couldnt have asked for a better location. We didn't want to be right on Las Ramblas so this was perfect, only a 5 minute walk from it and everything else. If you are in the mood for some great mexican food, there is a little restaurant down the street (the main one where the hop on bus picks up and as Starbucks) called Rosa Negra (i think). It had cheap margaritas and mojitos and excellent food. Highly recommend stopping there! Overall, I would recommend this hotel, largely due to the location!

Reviews.Title: “Upon arrival, they upgraded us to Hotel Colon, next door.”
Reviews.Author: RichoIndio
Reviews.Content: Arrived late Friday evening, and immediately greeted with offer to upgrade to sister property (Hotel Colon) and they transported our luggage up to room. Lovely hotel in what must be the best location for first-time visitor to Barcelona. Directly across from Cethedral (Gotic) and short walk to Ramblas shopping area, and easy walk to Picasso Museum, and easiest walk to Barcelona Tour bus (double decker) with on and off privileges at numerous stops. We really enjoyed the Casino stop, (actually won, can you believe it?) and had a delicious lunch (paella) with large portion for us two, with bottle of house Chardy. Back to our Hotel review, LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION. Friendly helpful staff. It was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and clean”
Reviews.Author: glenelg35
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel was its location, but it also had very good service. Our luggage had been lost and the reception staff were very helpful as we tried to retrieve it. In terms of the location, we were able to see the Gaudi architecture, including La Sagrada Familia, La Rambla, the port, the Picasso museum, and the labyrinth of el barrio Gótico all in one day, on foot, and even had time for a nap. Clean and comfortable, although plain, I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Very central location”
Reviews.Author: wombats-R-us
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right near the cathedral. A short walk to La Ramba, the markets and the old port area. It was easiest to find from the plaza in front of the cathedral as it is behind it’s 4 star sister hotel which fronts the plaza. The hotel provided a quiet room as requested on the booking form. Room was clean, comfortable and quite roomy. Helpful, friendly staff who spoke great English, but were happy to indulge you when you practiced Spanish on them. A 5 minute walk from the metro and the stop for the Big Red Tourist Bus is right on the cathedral plaza. It is in the old gothic barrio so many there are restaurants and bars near by.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and friendly, thin walls and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Millie74Derbyshire
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was wonderful and it was very clean. We had a room on the 1st floor and could hear a lot of noise coming from the reception area at night and people going up and down the stairs. If you stay in this hotel definitely ask for a room on a higher level. On the last night the room next to us was occupied, when they used the bathroom the walls were so thin it felt like they were in our room - very noisy and woke us several times in the night. The hotel description on lastminute.com advised that there was a bar - this was not open when we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Trip Advisors!”
Reviews.Author: lynne47
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on the reviews on this site and were not dissapointed. We only stayed 1 night prior to a cruise. When we arrived in a taxi from the airport (35 Euros, 4 people and bags) we were at first a little dissapointed as on first impressions it looks a bit drab and in a side street, however once through the door we could see it was very nice. lovely furnishings and marble floor in reception. We were checked in by a very smartl dressed male receptionist who was most helpfull, giving us guidebooks and maps, and most importantly spoke excellent english! |Our rooms were clean and comfortable, twin beds, wardrobe, flat screen tv, safe, no kettle but there rarely are in tourist hotels in Spain. \The bathroom had a full bath and shower, nice toiletries and very hot water. We found the breakfast perfectly adequete, it was served in the dining room and was very quiet, it was January and not many guests staying, there was a help yourself buffett of scrambled egg/ bacon/ sausage, yoghurts, fresh fruit, sliced ham and cheese, pastries, bread, preserves, cereals and tea and coffee, some commentd on this site have suggested the breakfast is poor but we were more than happy. The hotel is at the rear of the 'mother' hotel the Colon and we were told we could make full use of their facilities and charge drinks and evening meals to our room. We did have drinks and the Colon was very nice in a slightly old fsshioned way. One of the best things about the Regencia is the position, just 1 minute from the Cathedral and the gothic quarter, do explore the little streets and squares where you will find fantastic little Tapas bars and shops. Some reviews have suggested it is noisy, we did not fing this although of course it was January! We will definatly return to this hotel for a longer stay in Barcelona. We paid £62 per double room with breakfast and were very pleased with the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: wendell23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for four nights in January and found it to be a great hotel especially for the price. It is centrally located in the Barri Gòtic section of old Barcelona. It is steps away from the Cathedral of Santa Eulalia and less than a five minute walk to the great shopping on Portal de l'Àngel and the busy street Las Ramblas. Despite its central location, we found it to be reasonably quiet. This may have been due in part to our trip taking place during the off season but we had no complaints about noise. The hotel was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful with any questions we had for them. Our 4th floor room was a decent size and we didn't feel anything was missing other than an iron. Overall we felt the hotel was well worth the low price we paid for our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in best part of town”
Reviews.Author: sofresh21983
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I were thrilled with our three nights at Regencia. The hotel is just off the old square and a liesurely 5 min walk away from La Ramblas and lots of boutique shopping. It's a bit noisy on the streets outside at night, so if you're a light sleeper you may want to look for a quieter neighborhood. Ask for Victor at the desk. He'll give you the lowdown on the city, both good and bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Carol056
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very centrally and makes it easy to walk around the Gothic area/La Rambla/the Marina and find transport links to/from the airport and around the City. It is an easy 5 minute walk from the Airport bus terminus at Placa Catalunya. The reception staff were extremely helpful with information, and allowed us to check in even though we arrived before 11am in the morning, also looked after our bag when we checked out. Breakfast buffet was good, plenty of variety and all very fresh. The room was a reasonable size, clean and good selection of toiletries, but furnishings are looking a bite tired. However, we felt that the character of the building and the glass doors with little balcony made up for that. What we did not like was the heat in the room (it was not warm outside) and no apparent source so no way of turning it off. The air conditioning is turned off, which meant that we had to have the balcony doors open all night, and it was extremely noisy outside (we were on the 5th floor). Inside the hotel was very quiet, but outside there was noise of some kind all night. The bells from the cathedral can he heard, but I do not think those alone would wake anyone. Having said that, I do not know where you would go in central Barcelona to get away from noise, its a loud city. Overall, we enjoyed out stay and were happy with our choice as good value in a great location and with a good breakfast. The hotel sell discounted tickets for the open-topped bus tour which was good value, especially if you are short on time to see the sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, affordable, helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: upandsunny
Reviews.Content: This was a very affordable hotel. The location was great, just a few minutes' walk to Plaza de Catalunya or the Ramblas. Close to public transportation. The rooms were simple and clean. The hotel staff was so helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, but Nothing Special”
Reviews.Author: DCTeach
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to one cathedral, but all the way across town from the famed Sagrada Familia (which is quiet expensive). The hotel is clean, quiet, and in a safe part of town. Can't ask for a whole lot more!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: marcathy
Reviews.Content: Returned from Spain recently and our first stop, Barcelona, we stayed at the Regencia Colon. Fantastic location, really, really, really helpful staff, spoke great English, room was big and fortunately for us we got the only balcony they had which was huge, and I mean huge. Stayed three nights and it was great. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: lawton173
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 5 nights and it was nothing but hidden gem in what ended up being the perfect location, most of the city main attractions were within walking distance and the staff was incredible, it was chilly so we didn"t need AC and the noise wasn't really an issue since its Europe after all and noise in big cities should be expected. Would stay here if visiting Barcelona again, overall not an impressive Hotel when it comes to amenities but the location and the staff made the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: kchernack
Reviews.Content: Clean... friendly/helpful staff... great location... quiet! Wi-fi was weak.. had to go to sister Hotel Colon next door to get bandwidth. Very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The best sangrias”
Reviews.Author: Mitmer
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay here, but stopped by on our walks around the city three different times to sit at one of the covered tables and have a sangria. In our opinion, this place had the best sangrias out of any other place we visited.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints - Enjoyed Our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: aemlovesnegril
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent three nights at this hotel. From the moment we arrived, the front desk staff could not possibly have been more helpful and professional. They enthusiatically made restaurant reservations for us, gave us directions, stored our luggage on check-in and check-out days, etc. The hotel's location was EXCELLENT. Within minutes, we could walk to Las Ramblas, the waterfront, the Picasso Museum, El Born district, which we really enjoyed, lively tapas bars. The Cathedral was right outside the hotel. The hotel was a short walk from the Plaza Catalunya, where the airport bus drops people off. We easily walked with our luggage to and from the hotel. We were also able to pick up the Bus Touristic there, which we found very helpful. The room itself was spacious and clean. I brought earplugs in case of outside noise but did not use them at all. We felt completely safe at all times. Also, the young man at the front desk directed us to a wonderful restaurant just steps away from the hotel, just past a wine shop. Cannot remember the name but my boyfriend and I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Wow !!!”
Reviews.Author: Dublin18Calling
Reviews.Content: Will not attempt to find anywhere else to stay if & when I go back to Barcelona. This is the ideal location to base yourself. Do not be fooled or put off by thinking Las Ramblas or Barcelona Cathedral are too close for comfort. Rooms are lovely, bed lovely, Shower lovely. If I was the most arrogant man on the planet then I would complain about no view from our room - but luckily I am not lol. 5 minute walk to a load of museums, restaurants etc. Stayed in town for La Merce & guess where all the action was in the evening. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. Regards John in Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Real bargain”
Reviews.Author: ProfessorBob
Reviews.Content: Almost on the Cathedral Square, it is central to most major attractions. Rooms are good sized and reasonably comfortable. Staff is excellent and was attentive to all of my needs. Can get a fair amount of street noise at night, but didn't really bother me that much. Very reasonably priced--a great value. Also the Colon Hotel, same ownership, is next door. A lot more pricey, but restaurant and bar charges at the Colon can be charged to your room at the Regencia. Had an excellent meal at the Colon the first night. Regencia only provides breakfast, but it is quite good.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: hextablelife
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Regencia Colon 18-22 September and thought it was in possibly the nicest location of any hotel we saw. Its a good 3 star hotel with extremely courteous helpful staff and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone. The front desk staff gave us lots of information about what to do and see whilst in Barcelona, and when we expressed an interest in open topped tour buses, sold us tickets at a discounted rate. (This is a brilliant way to see the city) They didn't push this, just responded when asked. One night we returned to the hotel and my partner bounded up the front steps and completely missed the central opening part of the plate glass door and bounced off the fixed glass panel at the side (he blamed his poor eye sight but it may have had more to do with the local brew) and the chap on the desk was concerned and solicitous and supressed his mirth admirably (which was more than I managed to do!) We checked out the breakfast on the first morning and had it every day after that! At €12 it sounds expensive but it was really tasty and plentiful, with the usual spread of cereals fruit, yogurts toast, rolls, croissants & muffins - plus hot choices of scrambled egg, bacon and sausage, as well as Spanish cured meats (chorizo, morcilla etc) & cheeses. Fresh fruit juices tea & coffee. It was replenished right up until 10.30 when it finished. The room was larger than average and spotless, and the sheets were changed during our stay. The bed was a tad firm but that's just a personal preference. The bathroom had the usual array of toiletries, and the hot water was constant and the shower had good pressure. I have read comments that the hotel is in a noisy position, and to be honest there was quite a bit of noise but as it is only a stones throw from the beautiful old cathedral and the bells chime every 15 minutes so there's no getting away from that. Otherwise our stay wasn't typical because whilst we were there they were busy erecting the biggest stage I've seen outside Glastonbury, about 70 yards from the hotel, in preparation for Catalonia s largest music festival. There was a cherry picker type lift pipping all night and they were pressure hosing the stones. I would still say get ear plugs if you're a light sleeper rather than miss out on this lovely little hotel. One tip - the nicest restaurant we found by far was Les Quinze Nits (not a typo). It's in the Plaza Real and you can't miss it. Look for the huge snaking queue! Not only is everything delicious but it is cheaper than all it's neighbours. They lay up the tables for dinner at 8pm and the queue starts to form by about 6.45, so sit down about half six, have a few leisurely drinks and stay on for dinner. Lots of buskers to keep you amused. (And one or two 'characters')! A lot is made of the crime in the city and to be honest I did get a bit paranoid, and spent a lot of type clutching my handbag like it was some kind of security blanket, but luckily everything was fine. One word of caution. One of our party needed a car during our stay so we had to find parking. The Hotel have an agreement with a local car park and we got it half price but even so it was €20 per day. Unless you have to - don't bring the car! All in all a very very nice hotel in a fantastic position, will definately be making a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and awesome location!”
Reviews.Author: bogdanBucharest
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this hotel. The staff was very friendly, the room was very clean and the breakfast was ok. The location was wonderfull, close to metro station .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, friendly and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: maw2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in the second week of August for 2 nights. Hotel staff were all very friendly, and spoke really good english.Staff gave us tips on were to go on each night and maps and directions to the best bars and restaurants. The hotel itself was nice, clean and a bit quiet, which was good. The hotel is literally 20 seconds away from the well known catherdral, and the cathedrals square. Las Ramblas is approximately 6-7 minute walk away, the marina is about 25 min walk away, and the beaches are about 50 min walk away. The walk to the beach is not the bad really, as there's bars and restaurants, shops, etc everywhere you go, so theres always places to stop in and have a drink or bite to eat whilst your walking. It cost around 7-8 euros in a taxi from the beach back to the hotel, which is cheap. Check out was 12 o clock, but we were catching the bus from the bus station at 6pm, we asked the staff is there anyway we could leave our luggage, and they said no problem and we could put them in a locked cupboard until we were ready to go, which we did! this worked out very handy for us. The hotel is next door to Hotel Colon (sister hotel) which has a restaurant and WiFi access. But there's so much going on elsewhere around Barcelona, that we never visited this hotel, and ventured out elsewhere around the town. Some people may find it a little noisy outside at times but thats what you must expect from a central hotel!! if you want a hotel in a quiet surrounding, you will have to look right outside barcelona. We enjoyed our stay here and are planning on a weeks stay, next year, in August. Theres so much to see and do in Barcelona, it really is a great place to visit. The nightlife here is also really good, check out, Shoko + Opium down by the beach front. Bar 32, you may need to look this one up, its really small but the staff are great, we went with the bar staff at 3am to Razzmataz, which is a huge nightclub, really good!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect and safe location”
Reviews.Author: amarty1
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights here on a trip to Barcelona with one of my girlfriends. You cannot beat this location. Just a few short blocks from the L4 metro line (Jaume I, two stops from the beach), within walking distance of Plaza Catalunya, great shopping, La Rambla, and El Born. Lots of cute little shops and restaurants to discover in the winding streets near the hotel. The room was clean and a comfortable size (as far as European rooms go). Our bathroom was huge and bright. When we checked in we were given a room on the first floor and when we requested a room on a higher floor (being two young women) we were immediately given a room higher up. It was fairly quiet, considering the proximity to the cathedral. Very kind and courteous staff, and they spoke English well. We felt very safe there. The only downside was no internet, but we found an internet cafe quite close by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Right in the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: Dave61Essex
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Regencia Colon Hotel for 4 nights in June, If you want a good value hotel right in the centre of town, with great transport links, then this is the place for you. Clean functional rooms with the added bonus of a free safe. All the staff we dealt with were polite and efficant. Can be noisy at night, (nothing that a bottle or two of red wine won't cure). Barcelona is a great city, but petty crime is rife keep alert at all times!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bumpa2328
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights with 6 family members. The rooms were very comfortable and the breakfast was very substantial. Super location and helpful staff. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: SophAndSven
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the perfect location for all the major sites including the Catedral de Barcelona which is just around the corner from the hotel and La Rambla which is a short walk away. The hotel room was of ample size with a simple bathroom. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful and recommended the best places to visit during our stay. Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choice and was available between 7 & 10:30am. We would recommend that you take a taxi from the airport to the hotel, we tried to go by train and metro as we were told this would be the easiest way to travel, how wrong we were! There is no direct train from the airport to the centre of Barcelona, after an hour and a half of changing trains and metro in 30 degrees + temperatures we finally got to the hotel, a little hot and bothered! Taxi definately a must and will only cost around 25 euros. The city registered taxi drivers (yellow and black taxi cabs) are very helpful and will not rip you off. We would recommend the Bus Turistic for a day trip to get too and from the sites otherwise use a taxi as it is a long walk to and from places such as Sagrada Familia and Parc Guell in sweltering temperatures. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Bargain hotel”
Reviews.Author: RITripper
Reviews.Content: The Regencia Colon Hotel is in a perfect part of Barcelona; Gothic Quarter. It faces Cathedral Square, which is a lovely place to wander around: Look for the Roman Arch. The square has a number of restaurants (we had our breakfast at the Bisbe Restaurant every morning: very friendly staff, good cappucino and inexpensive), exchange bank and taxi stands. They have a number of flea market stalls on certain days, if you're interested in treasure hunting. The hotel itself is right across from the more expensive sister hotel, The Colon. The Regencia Colon is not for you if you're looking for extensive amenities, like swimming pool, room service, etc. However, it is a very clean hotel and our room had a wide screen TV (it receives 2-3 English channels), a small bathroom with tub and shower with a blow dryer. Since we did not spend much time in our room, this was a perfect hotel for us. The price was rock bottom and it had all we needed including a very comfortable bed. Our main concern was cleanliness and this hotel was very clean. As for the staff, they couldn't have been more helpful and congenial. They called for taxi's, reservations, and gave us wake-up calls whenever we requested. I would definitely stay there again. My only complaint would be that the street noise could be a little loud on weekends, but all of the other nights we fell asleep to the sound of the Cathedral of Barcelona's church bells.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous area, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: burgalay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regencia Hotel Colon for 7 nights. The staff was very friendly and most everyone spoke English (although I tried to use my minimal Spanish). They were helpful when we inquired about day trips out of Barcelona. They gave us our privacy and really only struck up conversation when we did. The rooms were very clean, and plenty of clean towels were placed in the room daily. The shower had good pressure. There was minimal street noise, but the hotel is located near a very busy square near the Catedral. I was never kept awake, though. The room was medium sized with a armoire with a safe inside. Overall, great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelerintheu
Reviews.Content: 1. Location The hotel is located in the city center, in the Barri Gotic near the Cathedral. Subway station is nearby (Jaume I, Placa de Catalunya,..). The hotel is located close to the main shopping area of Barcelona. Moreover it is close to many restaurants and bars. It's a 5 minute walk to the Rambla, which is the most famous street of Barcelona, and a 5-10 minute walk to Placa de Catalunya, the central area of the city where the aerobus drops you off when you're coming from the airport. A possible disadvantage of the central location is the fact that there is some noise from the street at night. Nevertheless I think this is typical for hotels in big cities. 2. Food The breakfast was pretty good for a 3 star hotel. Everything was fresh and there was enough choice.
