There were croissants, little breads, toasts, cakes, eggs and bacon, fresh fruit, yoghurts, ... The buffet didn't change during the six days we've stayed in the hotel. 3. Service The reception staff was always very friendly and helpful. They helped us with our questions about transport to the airport. The waiter in the morning wasn't really that friendly. He got mad quite quickly. When the breakfast room was full one morning, he practically yelled at people who were still trying to find a place to sit : "Compledo!! Full!" 4. Room The bedroom was rather small but comfortable. The bath was also pretty small, but good enough. The room was made up every day very well. There was soap, body milk, toothbrushes,... in the bathroom. There was a minibar (that was switched off) and a safe. One disadvantage: the first days of our stay we could litteraly hear almost every word our neighbours said. And they woke up around 7 am. The last days of our stay we got other neighbours who were much more quiet and calm. However, the isolation of the room just wasn't good enough, in our opinion 5. Facilities There is an elevator, a restaurant (only for breakfast) and a sitting and reception area. In the hotel next to "Regencia colon" was hotel "Colon". This is a 4* hotel located at the cathedral square. In this hotel there actually was a real restaurant where you could have dinner. Conclusion: A good 3* hotel with a perfect location. Nice breakfast. Rather poor isolation of the room. Perfect for a short citytrip. Very well for its price. Duration of stay: 6 days Price: around 300 euros p.p. Booked with thomas cook.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: MNGirl10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an ultra-touristy area, which is both good and bad. It is a no-frills hotel with okay bathrooms and minimal service. I read others' reviews on TripAdvisor prior to booking, and the comments about the continuous noise and garbage trucks all night is spot on. The hotel is clean, and its central location makes it an easy starting point for all sightseeing. We stayed at a great hotel (Park Hotel) in the Born district later on in the same trip, and if you have a few extra Euros to spare, it is well worth it for the nicer rooms, decent breakfast, better shopping, restaurants, better nights' sleep, and convenience of two metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location!”
Reviews.Author: FayeMar
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights; this is a fab hotel! As many people have said the location is the best, you could see the beautiful gothic cathedral from our room. Close to everything, couldn't be better. Our room was great for a three-start hotel. It was clean, plenty big enough and the bathroom was fine. One of the cheapest mini-bars I have encountered in a long time. There was some noise from outside on the Saturday night but what do you expect for the location? If it prevented people from sleeping, they're obviously not drinking enough cava . The desk staff were fine and tolerant of our lack of Spanish. I would definitely stay here again, especially for the price, which was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Regencia Colon”
Reviews.Author: BibliophileMaryland
Reviews.Content: The front desk starff were perfunctory but did their jobs. I had asked 2 months ahead of time for a QUIET room, and they put us in a room at the front of the hotel on the 2nd floor that was so extremely noisy night and day, it drove me to distraction. The windows are not double-paned, and the problem is, the Regencia faces a very narrow street with tall buildings on both sides that magnifies every shout, motorcycle (millions), truck, partying laughter, dog bark, and any noise at all, and this went on almost 24 hrs a day, including at 4 a.m. when they decided 2 men needed to go out front, wash down the street, and converse in clearly audible tones. Also, another past poster is correct--the breakfast is overpriced and not worth it. The room was fine (which helped) and clean (ditto), but the shower door was only a half door, so water got on the floor easily. It's central to Ramblas and Barri Gotic, but get a GOOD walking map, b/c the small winding streets make one lost fast, which is fun if you have time, but not if you're trying to get places. I don't think we would stay there again. Would seek a quieter section, but still not far from the action. It IS near Ramblas, Place de Catalunya, a beautiful church and square....just way too noisy, and we spent 3 nights there, not sleeping. However, all that said, Barcelona itself is a gorgeous and exciting city.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, excellent staff. Top marks.”
Reviews.Author: Thomas07364
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in this centrally located hotel beside the cathedral and only 10 mins walk to Las Ramblas. The room and ensuite were clean and tidy. Air-conditioned with shutters on the windows to keep out the heat and light of the sun. The staff were friendly and great assistance to us. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Location, Wonderful Desk Staff”
Reviews.Author: A3M
Reviews.Content: We would highly recommend the Regencia Colon Hotel! We made last minute reservations right before Easter and we were pleasantly surprised. There was adequate room for the three of us; the beds were comfortable; very accomodating front desk staff; the room was clean. We did hear a lot of street noise, but I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliantly located, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Wrinklies62
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent centrally located hotel just by the cathedral and not far from the North Bus Station and Estacion de Franca. Walkable provided you have wheely suitcases - otherwise take a taxi! Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Rooms very clean and comfortable and well serviced. Quiet for sleeping considering its central location. We were not kept awake at all. We had some very cold nights but the rooms were well heated. We had our breakfasts at local cafes nearby as the hotel breakfasts were quite expensive. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price-quality ratio, helpful service”
Reviews.Author: Kypeli
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location in the heart of the old gothic city centre. Literally one block from the square of the Gothic Cathedral. However, the hotel is on a small, pretty quite, street and the flock of tourists do not disturb. If you like shopping, Plaça de Catalunya and the main shopping street are close by. 10 minutes walk to Plaça de Catalunya. If you like cosy narrow streets with small shops and tapas restaurant, Born district is a 10 minutes walk away (and Jaume I metro station). Excellent location! The hotel itself is a modern establishment in an old house. The rooms are big, with air conditioning and warming and the windows have metal motorized blinds to shield from the heat on the summer. Our room had a double bed which was very comfortable to sleep in, a LCD TV and some extra chairs and a table so you could watch the TV with a glass of wine or two in the evening. The bathroom was pretty standard but with modern tile interior. Cleanliness was what you should expect from a hotel - that is, no problems, new towels every day (although we didn't even request for new ones) and the room was made very nicely every day! The front of house service was also good. They were very helpful to find and recommend restaurants, and you could buy tickets to different places from the front desk, although we didn't. They called a cab for us to the evening of our departure. No complains. The breakfast was pretty standard, but with some local specialities, mostly meat. If you are a vegetarian, you might find the breakfast a bit light. If I should find something to nitpick about, I would say that it was annoying that the bathroom for the room next door was by the door and the shower and toilets were very clearly heard to our room. But we couldn't hear people speaking in the other room, which means that the walls themselves are not too thin. Also, you can hear pretty clearly the noise outside if say a truck drives buy or people shouting. The windows are not by any means sound proof. But as a whole, these things didn't bother us too much.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Bargain”
Reviews.Author: EasyCruiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of the Gothic area just steps away from the famous and beautiful Barcelona Cathedral.You are also walking distance to most of the Gaudi archetectural attractions. Subway (Metro) and bus stops are also very close. I don't think you could find a better location. Walls are a bit thin and the beds are a bit hard, but considering the location and price, I can't imagine finding a better deal. The staff was incredibly courteous and helpful. After a pickpocket got my wallet on the Metro subway the front desk allowed me to use their phone to make all the international calls I needed to notify credit card companies and banks totally free of charge. They were also very helpful pointing me to local attractions. They all spoke excellent English. Rooms are larger than I expected based on general feedback I had heard earlier regarding the size of rooms in Barcelona. If you want to be in the middle of things and are willing to give up a little comfort this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect....”
Reviews.Author: chaniji
Reviews.Content: For the money, this really is a GREAT hotel. After a lot of consideration, I chose Regencia Colon for my first trip to Barcelona with the equally important criteria of location, safety and quality. The hotel was perfectly located, steps from the Cathedral, a very enjoyable 5 minute walk to La Rambla and a great 10 minute walk to Placa Catalunya. The rooms were an adequate size-perhaps a bit roomy by european standards. The bathrooms were modern and clean and the flat screen offered english language CNN and several other spanish language stations. The hotel staff was warm and friendly and even allowed us to check-in several hours early. Each attendant spoke perfect english, but I think they appreciated my attempts at speaking spainish and a little catalan, with the daily "bon dia". Overall, this was a great hotel, but earlier warnings about noise are justified. For some odd reason, garbage trucks come through the area about 4 times per evening--and although some don't actually pick up the garbage, they make a loud racket. This is easily fixed however by using earplugs. If you were like me and want a place where you will feel secure, welcome and close to the action - then this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Barcelona Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kauai22
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel for it's location - very central in Barrio Gotic. Very helpful staff, good English, nice rooms, comfortable beds. Many restaurants nearby, some non-smoking (important to us). ATM 50 paces away. Bus Turistic one block away. La Bouqueria market 5 minutes walk. We stayed here for three days prior to our Mediterranean cruise and had a lovely time. Desk staff cautioned us often re: pickpockets. We were only approached once at the waterfront by two girls with a phony English petition to sign - waved them off safely. Many others on our cruise stated that they were robbed upon arrival at the airport, or going to their hotel, losing passports, money, and credit cards. I had invested in a bra pouch before leaving the USA and used it, so I guess we were lucky. Just be very cautious and do not carry a wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: WBCLithgow_Australia
Reviews.Content: What a perfect place this is to stay in Barcelona. The location is excellent, just by the Cathedral square, La Rambla and walking distance to most of what you would wish to see in Barcelona in three days. What is even better though is the quality of the hotel. The staff are so welcoming and helpful, trying to help you get the best out of your stay with them with maps, directions, the lot! The rooms are what you dream of - spotlessly clean, spacious, and the bathrooms also roomy but very modern. While the rooms are of such a high quality, the older world charm of the building has been retained. We loved it, thought it was great value for money and would definitely stay there again. Location, character, service, security, comfort, friendliness - it has it all. We recommend it to anybody and our teenage youngsters loved it too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fab location”
Reviews.Author: ReubenLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at the regencia colon. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting barcelona who wants a good central location (just behind the cathedral square), and value for money. The hotel was nice and clean, we had a double bed not two twins put together, the entrance was on a well-lit street that felt safe literally 20 seconds from the cathedral square. The staff were helpful and had good English. We didn't sample the breakfast so can't comment on that. We would definitely return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rumples
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Regencia Colon Hotel for five nights in December 2008. The location in Barri Gotic close to the cathedral can't be beat for easy access to La Rambla, Palau de la Musica Catalana, Placa de Catalunya, excellent places to eat at many prices, the hop on/hop off bus, and much, much more. Our fifth-floor room was good sized, immaculate and had a comfortable bed and two comfortable padded chairs. Plenty of space existed for hanging and storing items. Amenities included a safe, a flat-screen TV with English channels, a hairdryer and toiletries. The room had two windows with tiny balconies that were decorative rather than useful. If noise bothers you, however, avoid this hotel or bring excellent earplugs.. Street noise that comes in includes vehicular traffic, voices of people in the cathedral area, and an amazing clatter at 1 a.m. that appears to be a trash collection service in action. Walls are paper thin so you can hear conversations, hairdryers in use and clanging showers. The hotel offers a good buffet breakfast with both hot and cold items for 11.77 euros, including tax. There are many less expensive alternatives in the neighborhood for those who don't require a lot of food in the morning. We did not consider the room rate to be good value during the Christmas period when we stayed at the hotel. Unlike other reviewers, we found the room to be high priced. That's because of the holiday rate increase when Barcelona becomes a major destination. Though the desk staff proved to be friendly and helpful, one man really pushed taking the taxi to the airport, claiming that it would be a fixed price if booked through the hotel. The price proved to be higher than what was quoted at the hotel and we found ourselves in an unpleasant situation with the taxi driver. For those who want to take a taxi, I recommend that you insist that the meter be used even if booked through the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: klasf
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right behind the pricey "Hotel Colon." It's on a quiet street right off the main plaza. Everything was in very close proximity - we felt like we were in the middle of it all. Also, it's about a 10 minute walk from where the airport shuttle lets off. I would definitely go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: travelwise
Reviews.Content: The Regencia Colon is a great budget option if you want to be situated in the heart of the Barri Gotic. The hotel itself is located right behind its more expensive sibling, the Colon so it is just steps from the Cathedral Plaza. Nicely decorated and well maintained, the hotel is up a set of about six or seven steps and has an excellent elevator. Half a short block away is Laitana, a major street running toward the harbor, and just on the other side of that is the Born with its restaurants, shops, and nightlife. If you cross the Cathedral Square in the other direction, you are in the heart of some great Barri Gotic shopping streets, the hot chocolate cafes on Calle Petritxol, and Las Ramblas (just a half block from the Boqueria). If you head away from the Cathedral, you will quickly come to the Placa Catalunya, about two to three blocks from the hotel. If you take the Aerobus from the airport to the last stop at Catalunya, you simply need to walk down Portal del Angel to the Cathedral Square, turn left, and then left again at the end of the Colon and you will be at the Regencia Colon (about ten minutes). There is a taxi stand across Laitana so it isn’t necessary to call cabs unless you need someone to pull in front for heavy bags. I always told taxis to take us back to Laitana, circa del Catedral, (very easy) and that got us right around the corner. I stayed in this hotel twice, once for a long weekend before a cruise and then for another long weekend at the end. The two rooms which I was given, 556 and 557, were next to each other on the fifth floor (which I had requested) and close to the corner where there is a partial view of of the Cathedral Square (and lots of light but not a view of the Cathedral). The rooms were identical, mirror images of each other. Decorated in chintz, each came equipped with two beds, a desk, a minibar with room to put a couple of water bottles, a safe, a place to hang clothes with very limited drawer space, and a desk chair. The room was certainly decently sized and perfectly adequate. The fifth floor has tiny balconies outside the rooms on this side of the hotel. The balconies are miniscule, but you can step out and check the weather. There are shutters on the doors which can be lowered to keep out light and the hotel uses old fashioned metal keys, which are kept at the desk. The bathroom was small, but also perfectly fine. It contained a hair dryer, a tub with shower, toilet and bidet. Everything worked. Toiletries provided included a shampoo/conditioner, shower gel, soap, and toothpaste/toothbrush kits, shower cap, and a shoe-shine cloth. The safe was quirky but worked. Instructions say to press the red button on the back of the door to reset the combination. Unfortunately, there is no red button and when you press the button that is there, you need to make sure you press and hold it sufficiently before trying to enter your new code. If you need help, one of the desk guys will come up. There are some differences between the Regencia Colon and a more expensive hotel (I stayed in the NH Duc de la Victoria last year, for example, and found the bed and bedding there of higher quality.) The Regencia Colon lacked Kleenex and there are no robes or slippers. The desk guys (Jose, Luis and David) are all very nice and try to be as helpful as possible. Just know that their knowledge can be limited (especially related to food!) We were given directions to the PANS when we wanted to go to the Bocatta one day. Victor, who does the reservations and is very efficient, seemed to have no knowledge of most of my restaurant requests. I provided him with the telephone numbers and he made the calls (I had written to the hotel several weeks in advance to make the reservations, but they said there had been computer problems and they hadn’t received the requests.) If you do your homework and simply need help with the map, you’ll be okay or if you want suggestions for the neighborhood, they can help. We also asked for extra towels and pillows and received these without any problem. At these prices you can’t expect first rate concierge-quality help. As many have commented, the rooms at the front of the hotel are just off the Cathedral Square, which often features loud music blared through speakers and a variety of concerts. The Cathedral clock chimes every fifteen minutes. People can be noisy and the noise seems to carry very easily. We also noted the arrival of the garbage trucks sometime early (or maybe in the middle of the night) on the first morning we were there. The big problem is that the room in November was stifling hot. Since you can’t control the heat (and apparently once the hotel turns it on, it stays on until the month they turn it off), you are forced to open the doors or windows. While this solves the temperature problem, it means you will need ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. Since I have no trouble going back to sleep, it was a minor problem for me, but I can see how it would be a big problem for others. There is plenty of eating close by. You can walk to virtually all of the Barri Gotic eateries and those in the Born. For breakfast, there is a PANS and a Bocatta two minutes away, Neyras is around the corner, and best of all, the Boqueria is an easy walk away for a memorable breakfast. Don't miss the Boqueria -- it's a fabulous market just for sightseeing. The front desk sells Hop On Hop Off bus tickets for the same price you pay at the Catalunya hub. If you buy at the hotel, you can get on the Blue Route bus right across Laitana and do the entire loop without having to stand on line at Catalunya. If you want the Red Route, you simply transfer at the first transfer point, which is the Gaudi houses – La Padrera and Casa Bottilo (the first stop for the Red Route). As many have said, the HOHO bus is the best way to do the sights in Barcelona. We paid 26 euros for two consecutive days (the cost is 23 euros for one day at the moment). You can stay on the bus and get an overview, get off at the stops that interest you and ride the buses as many hours as you like. We paid different rates for different nights at the Regencia Colon (it was significantly cheaper at the end of November than it had been two weeks before but I think it also depends on the cruise schedules since many of their clients seemed to be cruisers.) I booked through the hotel website and we paid in euros at the end of each stay, which worked well for us since the value of the dollar was significantly better when we paid than when we booked! On the whole, other than the noise problem, this is an excellent pick if you want to save money and be in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jinglegirl_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a terrific location just across from the Gothic Cathedral. Our room was small but neat and clean. Based on the reviews I had read of hotels in Spain, I actually expected it to be smaller, so I was pleasantly surprised. The service was outstanding. All of the people at the front desk were exceptional and spoke good English. Victor was particularly helpful. The airline had lost some of our luggage and upon check-in when we told Victor about it, he started working on it for us. He had one piece delivered before we went to bed that night. The other piece is still missing but that is another story. Overall, we couldn't have been more pleased with our hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Close to most things.”
Reviews.Author: Letsgo75
Reviews.Content: The Regencia Colon was close to most things I needed. You can walk to the waterfront, Las Ramblas, or even the Sagrada Familia. The staff were friendly and helped with booking some days trips for me.

Reviews.Title: “good location but noisy”
Reviews.Author: rummyuk
Reviews.Content: Location perfect, hotel clean and staff speak good english. However, poor breakfast choice and too noisy (from outside), so the insulation needs improving. Also, at times a lot of noise from adjacent rooms

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and good location.”
Reviews.Author: NapoliRaffaele
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the hotel. The room was a good size and clean. The service was outstanding. The people at the desk were very pleasant and helpful and friendly. The location was excellent, near the Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Regencia”
Reviews.Author: martymc1
Reviews.Content: The Regencia is probably one of the best hotels I have stayed in. The staff were extremely helpfull and nothing was too much trouble for them. Its location is superb, just a few mins from the Rambala and the Playa De Catalyuna. The Rambalas can get very noisy at night so this was ideal, just far enough away from the noise. The hotel was very clean and extremely well kept. There are plenty of lovely cafe's shops and restaurants around the area so you wont have to travel far to eat if you don't want to base your self in the hotel all the time. I would reccomend this hotel to everyone. I would definitley stay there again when (not if) I go back to Barcelona. Don't forget to try the steaks in the Hard Rock Cafe while visiting the city. Stay in the Regencia Colon. You wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: kababs
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel both pre and post cruise. the location can't be beat! There was some noise at night but we were so tired it didn't bother us a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Tessea
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Regencia Colon. Everything about the hotel was exactly what we expected. The room was above average and the bathroom was spacious. The location was absolutely perfect and allowed us to walk to most areas. The noise was an issue at night, but we were forwarned. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTJ
Reviews.Content: Great location near beautiful cathedral. Many restaurants close by. Port Olimpic 2 stops away by tube for fun young bars, beach and lovely seafood restaurants. Bus Touristic well worth 26 euros for two day pass - can hop on and off as you please. Hotel staff are very friendly and happy to help, rooms comfortable and clean. Cable car up to the castle is beautiful - great view.

Reviews.Title: “My Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Brightontravels
Reviews.Content: Second time here and Third planned for 09! I love this hotel, The staff are great, the hotel itself is great, The rooms are great! And the location is fantastic!! Would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at Regencia”
Reviews.Author: Texas7
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at Regencia after a cruise. Expected the noise to be awful after reading previous reviews; however, the noise was not nearly as bad. I had brought earplugs - just in case. Apparently we arrived at the beginning of a holiday weekend (St. John's) and was told by locals that the noise in Barcelona that weekend would be outrageous and go all night long but we had no problems with noise thankfully. Also, dined at Estruch and had no problems as a previous poster did -- maybe we were lucky or he/she was just unlucky. Ate at Catedral restaurant at Hotel Colon and enjoyed a really good meal facing the plaza. Hotel Regencia Colon was small, nicely run and maintained, staff was pleasant and helpful. Very clean. Nothing fancy but in a good location, nice and clean accommodations and made for an enjoyable stay for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: pchTexas
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the Regencia Colon, near the Cathedral and Las Ramblas. The front desk staff was helpful, especially in helping us to avoid getting caught in a city-wide taxi strike by pre-booking our cab. Our room was spacious and bathroom lovely! this hotel is the twin to the more deluxe Colon (right next door), but without some of the extras. We did miss having internet access and a breakfast included, but there are so many possibilities for eating the the neighborhood that it was not too much of an inconvenience. This hotel is a great value in a spectacular city, and you are right in the middle of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: cix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I looked for a moderately priced hotel in the heart of Barcelona, and Regencia Colon did not disappoint. Location can't be beat! Room was fresh and clean, larger than what one usually finds in the old parts of other European cities. Bathroom was modern & clean. Staff was accomodating and friendly. Naturally, being in the middle of the touristy barri gotic, there was some noise from the street - but nothing out of the ordinary (and since we're on the topic, I always carry a pair of earplugs which on many occasions saved the day - or should I say the night). All in all, I'd stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Confirmed reservation, but no room available when we arrived”
Reviews.Author: cbee201
Reviews.Content: I reserved two rooms several months in advance and confirmed them via email one week before arrival. Nonetheless, we were apologetically told by the staff that they had overbooked and had no rooms available and were transferring us to its sister hotel Colon. Unfortunately, the Colon Hotel rooms turned out to be run down, with stained upholstery, linens, and carpeting, no air conditioning, and an old, lumpy bed. We found a new hotel. I never saw the rooms at the Regencia, so I can't comment on them (the lobby was simple but clean), but the experience was disappointing and stressful as we scrambled to find an acceptable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: eniddly
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location just near the cathedral, fabulous base for seeing all the sights. The noise mentioned by others is quite incredable really but I can't see how it would be much different in any other hotel......Barcelona is by far the noisiest place I have ever ever been but once you get used to it you hardly notice it. Ear plugs might be a good idea for light sleepers as the bin men have to be heard to be believed & once heard you aren't getting back to sleep! Our room was a good size, the bathroom was large too and both were clean and tidy. They were also cleaned every day. Staff all very friendly and speak good english so no concerns at all really. Would definately recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip and will certainly stay there again when we go back to Barcelona. On a slight side note and not to do with the hotel, generally the aquarium in Barcelona is really heavily advertised and all the tour operators try to push tickets. We did go and would never do this again, it might just have been bad timing but with the 10 or so school groups that were there we couldn't get anywhere near most of the displays and when we did we found them to be dirty and far too small for the majority of the fish inside. Aside from the sscreeching of hundreds of children which is never my favourite thing we found the conditions a bit distressing, particularly the octopusses which did not have anything to hide behind or interact with in their bare tank and just smashed their heads against the glass. Avoid, it's horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend”
Reviews.Author: RecaLondon
Reviews.Content: Just back from our stay at the Regencia Colon. Thought value for money it was great. Right in the centre of town, everything you could want to see within easy walking or metro distance. Room was very clean. Hairdryer in bathroom. Flat screen TV in room. Was a little noisy from the rubbish collections at night, but really this is to be expected when you are in the centre of a big city. We never book a hotel anywhere now without checking it out on Trip Advisor, which we did with this hotel and were not disappointed. Also did our homework on restaurants before we went and had some of the best meals we have had in Europe. We will stay at the Regencia Colon again when we next go back to Barcelona, which cannot come soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not”
Reviews.Author: JFloss
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the web site must come from another place and time. The room was small and the furniture shabby. It was very clean and the beds comfortable. The one positive was that you had no desire to hang out in your room because it was so wonderful. And take heed to the warnings about the street noise at night. The building is very old and has thin plate glass windows. But there is a pharmacy just around the corner that sells ear plugs. Good location - walking distance to just about all of the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Best quality- price value”
Reviews.Author: alvarezgranda
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a million times better and cheaper that the Colon one. I have been in both and I can say that this one should be the 4 star one. The rooms are big, clean, with lots of decoration and most of them have a balcony. The staff is very friendly and helpfull. The restaurant is quite good too. The location is unbeatable, right in front of the Cathedral.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Very nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: Arthur230
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Hotel Regencia Colon by cab from the airport. We were very pleasantly surprised about how well the guys at the desk spoke English. We wanted to get started seeing the sights right away and they were eager to help us with maps, tips, etc. We were given a triple room for two people so it was very roomy!. It was clean and ready for us even though we arrived before check-in time. We were instructed to leave our key at the front desk when we left the hotel and then retrieve it when we got back. I think this was for security reasons but it was not a hassle and they knew us by our faces before we even asked for the key after one or two times. And I never felt like safety was as big an issue in Barcelona as it was in Madrid. The hotel is in the optimum location in my opinion as far as ease of getting around the city...just a block or two from La Rambla. And the location may be what led to the only negative in my mind at the hotel and that was the noise at night from the street. There is noise from scooters and large metal doors shutting just about all night. Fortunately, we had earplugs and were able to get to sleep when we had those in our ears. There is also about a ten minute walk to use the internet as there is not access in the hotel. Based on the location, the friendly staff and the size/comfort of the room, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, had to find from the directions”
Reviews.Author: nursepower10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in October. We booked the hotel through the hotel's website, the rates were good. Directions seemed simple enough, even searched different directions. Unfortunately, this hotel is very hard to find. There are two different metro stops you can take, but no directions once you are out on the street. We even had a map. We found the hotel by accident, we were actually in the courtyard of the huge church and looked up! Once we found it, it was very easy to locate again, the hotel is actually in a great location from other sites. The hotel is booked as having a lift (for those who are handicapped), but it neglects to say that you have to walk up more than 6 steps to get to the reception area. The hotel staff is very pleasant and helpful, and assisted us with our bags. Our room was very nice, clean, and a good value as compared with other hotels in the area. The hotel is walking distance to Las Ramblas, two metro stops, and the main shopping area. I would recommend this hotel, but for those who cannot walk up steps, it would be a bad choice, as I didn't see another entrance to get to the reception area. Adriennepollack@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Claymoreruss
Reviews.Content: Excellent location across from Cathedral a few metres off a main square in Gothic Quater of Barcelona. La Rambla is only a short walk away up interesting side streets. Bus Turistic stop & taxis within 50 metres, metro stop within 200 metres. Great helpful staff & comfortable rooms. Barcelona is a city with something for everyone & only a philistine would not be stunned by the Sagrida Familia. Great transport systems available & bus from airport stops in Catalonia square only 250 metres walk through a main shopping street

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and great price”
Reviews.Author: BrewingRover
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and absolutely loved it. The desk clerk told us that we were in the very best location in Barcelona when we checked in and after three days we agreed. The hotel is an easy walk to Placa Catalunya, which is an airport bus stop, and right on the edge of the Bari Gotic, which is loaded with restaurants and shops. It's also close to the Metro, La Barceloneta and its beach and Las Ramblas. The room was large for a two-star hotel and very clean. We faced the street, which was noisy, but we came prepared with earplugs after reading about noise in general in Barcelona. The staff were helpful and polite and indulged my wife's attempts to use her high school Spanish (actually, she did very well). We did not have the breakfast buffet but it looked good. There are a lot of coffee bars that do pastries and breakfast sandwiches in the area for less. Don't miss Neyras Restuarant on Via Laietana for dinner. I would stay here again with no hesitation. I don't think you can get such a great combination of price and location elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT Location!”
Reviews.Author: lagunamarie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly within walking distance to Plaza Catalunya and Jaume metro stations, which made it extremely easy to get anywhere else in the city. It is almost directly behind Snata Creu, which is nice. Our room faced the street and it wasn't noisy at night. We were there Oct 29-Nov 1, 2007. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. Occasionally, we heard plumbers working on the pipes, but it was during the day, and not distracting. The only negative, if you can call it that, was lack of internet access. You had to go across the alley to their sister hotel Hotel Colon, to use the WiFi. Even then, it was unreliable. I HIGHLY recommend La Locanda restaurant, which is very close to the Regencia Y Colon. Great food, decent prices. I'm still craving their gnocchi pesto!

Reviews.Title: “I like it, but it is a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: PJ_eLiverpool
Reviews.Content: There wasn't much wrong with this hotel for me and my family (wife and two and a half year old son) except that it was a little noisy of a night. The room (Triple room) was a good size and the airconditioning was good and effective. The bathroom was a little cozy but functional and not a problem for us. We didn't partake of breakfast as we prefered to eat out. (there's sso many eateries nearby!) The staff were excellent and spoke good English as well as putting up with my garbled attempts to speak to them in Spanish. The only fault really was that of a night there was a lot of noise from outside, both people, traffic and particularly (it seemed) bin wagons and deliveries. We were on the first floor (Primera Planta) so this may be less of a problem higher up. Location can't be faulted - right next to the cathedral and within easy walking distance of Placa Catalunya and also Port Vell. I wouldn't knock the hotel - jus ask for a higher floor, take ear plugs or have a few drinks to help you sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Good location,very clean,very reasonable”
Reviews.Author: Eljak
Reviews.Content: Just returned from four days in this hotel.It is just off the Cathedral Square, and most places`are very accessible.Our room was spotlessly clean, had a flat screen TV with Sky News and CNN plus a mini-bar and air conditioning.We had a room on the first floor at the front which overlooked a small street with the Colon Hotel opposite.The buffet breakfast had plenty of choice although it was the same each day.The reception staff were all very pleasant and helpful and most spoke good English.It could be slightly noisy at night but this may have been because we preferred to have the window slightly open! I would reccomend this hotel to any-one wanting a reasonably priced hotel in the centre of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OceanLiz
Reviews.Content: Great hotel located in a perfect location for exploring the city. The room was clean and spacious for a European hotel. Room had a minibar/fridge which was great for storing leftover meat, cheese, and fruit from the market. On a side note, if you have an extra day and want to go to the beach, take the train to Sitges. It's about a 40 min ride and costs only 4 or 5 euros round trip. You can rent cabanas and beach chairs for 18 euro for the day. It is a fabulous little beach town!

Reviews.Title: “Regencia Colon - a very cosy hotel in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: VaniaBrazil
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid for this hotel, it is more than GREAT! Location is excellent, within a walking distance to the Ramblas, Museu of Picasso, the plaza where all the tours depart etc, staff is very nice and really want to serve you. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: deannsegal
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel, a sister to the Hotel Colon. It is a block from the Cathedral in Barrio Gotico. The staff is multi-lingual, very helpful and friendly. The rooms were great. Our friends had a room with a large terrace where we sat at night with wine and tapas. We had a triple room with our teen aged son. The room was large for European standards at a great price. We were a short walk from Las Ramblas, and the Plaza de Cataluña. There are plenty of restaurants in the area. This hotel is a great value for the money and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: km_77
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Regencia Colon for 3 night in 01/07. Its in a great location (bang in the middle of the Gothic Quarter) only minuted from the La Ramblas.The staff were also extremely helpful ,given the reputation British tourists have in Spain.One review had mentioned the noise at night but we did not find it a problem (things might be different in summer) Would definitely stay there again next time we are in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel in an even better location”
Reviews.Author: Movadoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed with wife and friends for a long weekend at the end of July. Hotel is excellent value for money. Located behind its sister hotel, the Hotel Colon in the Gothic Quarter and only 200 metres from the Cathedral and 250 metres from the Via Laetana. The rooms were clean, spotless, well-decorated and appointed rooms but a little on the small side. The room plans shown on the fire escape diagram seemed to indicate that there were bigger rooms available, but unfortunately for us the hotel was full. Next time we will contact the hotel directly and arrange to be allocated a bigger room. Beds were very comfortable, air conditioning was very effective and shower superb. Towels were changed every day and sheets every other day. Any room limitation was more than compensated by the exceptional location, helpful and friendly staff and the excellent buffet breakfasts. There was even an in-room safe to store your valuables. We would recommend this hotel staying for 3-5 nights in wonderful Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great place - ask for the room with a terrace”
Reviews.Author: monkeykieran
Reviews.Content: Just ask for the one room that has a private terrace, thats what I did, it didnt cost me any more than a standard room and was absolutely perfect! the staff were more than friendlt, it was very very comfortable with great air con, and i was recommended by the manager a fantastic local restaurant, im sure he'd oblige and assist. The location speaks for itself, right next to the cathedral, but behind the hotel colon so it's pretty quiet too! (mind you it backs on to a very very busy main road (but doesnt everywhere) so when the window or in our case terrace door is open it's pretty busy sounding.

Reviews.Title: “Great sightseeing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SydneyWineLover
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed 3 nights. Great priced rooms for a fantastic location for sightseeing, nothing is far away which means that when you have had enough you are only a short trip from your bed. We had a corner room on the 5th floor, it was clean, a good size, great shower with views to the Cathedral. Staff were more friendly after we attempted to speak Spainish. Unfortunately, there was no kettle to make your own tea/coffee, also, if you are a light sleeper pack ear-plugs. But I reckon that is a "feature" of Barcalona, not just the hotel. For breakfast we avoided the tourist restaurants and headed to the amazing market off Las Ramblas for coffee and tortilla, very cheap when sitting at the bar/counter. Avoid the restaurants in the Cathedral Square (and Las Ramblas), absolute rip off. We wanded off round the back streets and found a tapas place in a square with fantastic food and realistic prices. With regards to the pick-pocket warnings you read about, we did not see anything to worry about. If you are street smart you will have (hopefully!!) have no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, personal service”
Reviews.Author: CheapTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Hotel Regencia Colon for four nights in June, 2007. We were in Barcelona for the Moto GP race in Montmelo, a suburb of Barcelona. We chose the HRC for its central location, proximity to the station, and price. We weren't disappointed. We were greeted warmly by the front desk. Our overnight train arrived in Barcelona at 10am, so we arrived at the hotel at 10:30. Our room wasn't ready but the hotel stored our bags while we started sightseeing. Our room, 259, was a corner room with a view of the Cathedral. The room was large with a great bathroom. The large bed, wardrobe, and desk had plenty of room for everything we had accumulated over 2 weeks in Europe. The staff, in particular Paolo, were warm, friendly, and very helpful. They gave us fantastic advice, directions, and recommendations. Breakfast was simple and good. Eggs, bacon, toast, croissants, melon, juice, and more. Don't miss La Locando, an Italian restaurant just around the corner. Their pizza and calzone rivaled the food that we had just left in Italy. I can't say enough about the staff at this hotel. After we missed our flight home, they arranged a room for us at their sister hotel, Hotel Colon. They were full that evening, but there was availability at The Colon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: rdgcmg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the Gothic Quarter near the Cathedral. The location is perfect for sightseeing. We stayed 5 nights for $135 a night. Considering the cost and location the hotel was a bargain. We had a large corner room. Not only was the bed comfortable, but both the room and bathroom were spacious and immaculate. The hotel staff cheerfully made our dinner reservations, arranged wake up calls, and arranged for taxi pickup to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of street noise”
Reviews.Author: FromBrazil71
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Colon many years ago when in Barcelona on business. Therefore the Regencia Colon attrracted my attention as I liked the Colon. Both hotels are very well located in the heart of the city with public transporation near by and the famous Rambla just a few minutes away on foot. The hotel is lovely with a good sized room, a nice bathroom, a helpful front office crew, and a very good breakfast for 10 Euros. Barcelona is an expensive city so 135 Euros for a double seemed reasonable. I would suggest that one find a quieter place if sleeping is a priority. Revelers, garbage trucks and construction never ceased. Other than that, the hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “We said that we would be back and we have been”
Reviews.Author: BlythCashier
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself return home yesterday after a 4 night stay at the Regencia Colon Hotel. We stayed there last year and decided that if we went back to Barcelona we would stay at the Regencia. Everything was as it was last year. We even had the same room! The only slight hitch was that for the first 24hours the heating was off. A little moan and groan and Hey Presto the heating was on. This is a well situated, clean, friendly hotel. Ladies there is no need to take a hairdryer or shampoo. There are even packets with a toothebrush and toothpaste in them. What more do you want? We wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. It is well worth a try. Excellent value for money. A good stay. We will be back again next year. For 3 rashers of bacon, 2 fried eggs, 1 slice of toast with butter 4euro 90 cents at the Licra cafe come restaurant (coffee extra) next to the hotel of the same name on the Ramblas. Very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Few comments on this hotel..only complaint was”
Reviews.Author: SuePhoenix
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more pleased with Regencia Colon. The location was absolutely perfect, the hotel was clean, the staff was helpful and the 10 E buffet breakfast was decent and convenient. I, too, had trouble with their website, but when I contacted a travel agent, she was able to get me the room I wanted at the correct price, and the hotel paid her commission. The one complaint I had was the recommendation of the front desk staff for a Flaminco show. They hand out these pamphlets for Tablao "Cordobes". I was awful. We felt as if we had just been ripped off my a bunch of gypsies.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: finandcath
Reviews.Content: What a brilliant hotel, right in the centre of Barcelona. 4 of us stayed at this hotel for 3 nights the staff were so helpful and always there on hand when you needed them. The rooms were very clean, modern and suited our needs. Just a few minutes walk from Las Ramblas, which we found very expensive to have a snack and a few drinks, better sticking to the restaurant at the top of the street near the hotel. The hotel was very handy for the tour bus, and we also went on the Catamaran tour of Barcelona. Lovely city and would return and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Fran22w
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful surprise. This hotel situated just behind it's posher big sister The Colon Hotel was perfect. The standards of cleanliness and service were second to none. Bed linen and towels were changed daily. The service was both professional and friendly. The staff at the front desk went that little bit further to make our stay so pleasant. Location wise it was perfect, quiet yet central. Have already recommended this to friends

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit in 6 weeks - Loved it more thsi time!!”
Reviews.Author: MarkieG
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed in this hotel this time for 2 nights (6th-8th Feb). When we arrived (11:30am) we had to wait for our room to be ready but this was expected as the hotel was pretty much full and check in time of 14:00 is stated. Whilst we where waiting out bags where safely stored so we could get accustomed with the city. Again we booked through expedia and paid £42 a night i believe. For that price you would not expect such a nice hotel, room and friendly staff. When we got into our room it was really large and everything worked perfectly in there. Cant remember our room number this time but it was on the front of the building on 5th floor (top). This time i noticed that the temperature of the shower would be quite dodgy in the morning between say 9 and 11. One minute hot the next close to freezing!! TV worked in this room and hairdryer in this bathroom was a normal one unlike room 158. All in all i still loved this hotel and as far as i can see right now, my next visit to Barcelona is going to be staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: nemesis75
Reviews.Content: I was quite amazed with the reviews of people travelling at the same period in Barcelona and stayed at the hotel on the same dates. We spent one week at the Regencia Colon, the first week of January. Although we didn't speak any catalan or castellan spanish but only english we were warmly greeted. The receptionists gave us a map, directions and plenty of information on what to see etc. They also recommended places to eat (a restaurant near urquinaona sq. which was very nice) and even made reservations for us. The rooms were in a good status for a three star hotel, I would say better than I expected, it had an lcd television, a minibar and the bathroom was in a good condition, plus the towels and toiletries were being changed daily. I have to say we booked directly at the hotel's site and got a price of 60 euros for a double room, without breakfast. Needless to say it was a great price for such a big and lovely room. Outdoors, in the small cafes around the hotel you could get breakfast at very low prices. An espresso doesn't cost more than 1.2 euro and a caffe leche (cafelatte, coffee with milk) doesn't cost more than 1,5, average. The location of the hotel was absolutely fantastic, everything is max. a 10 minutes walk from the entrance of the hotel, all the markets, stores, museums ecc. We bought the T-10 card for metro, bus etc. instead of 10 single tickets, but in a week we hardly used all of them. We went everywhere on foot. Another pro of this hotel is that it is not situated in a main road, or a paved area, so at night, when tourists drink and get happy, you cannot really hear them :) We never had any problem sleeping, our room was in the 3rd floor. The only drawback of this hotel was that the heating on the last 2 days was higher than it should be, taken into consideration that those days were quite warm in Barcelona, warmer than average January.

Reviews.Title: “Service so bad I didn't even manage a reservation”
Reviews.Author: cottonfoo
Reviews.Content: I haven't stayed there, and I don't think I ever will despite the glowing reviews. Was recommended by my best mate at the weekend so I tried to reserve a room online. Their website doesn't use any form of strong encryption so if that worries you, book over the phone. It won't even work with most popular browsers - that is if their booking engine is up and running, which it isn't a lot of the time. You may run into some stumbling blocks on the phone though, such as reception being uninterested, cutting me off three times, putting me through to a non-existent reservation section that doesn't answer, emails going unanswered despite being told to mail them my details, their online form being ignored, then finally being told on the phone to "call back in a few days when it's not so busy". I guess if they're that apathetic to getting customers they can do without me because if I pay that much for a room, I expect them to jump when I try to reserve one :)

Reviews.Title: “Not the best hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: Big-Penguin
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, could not be better. The hotel itself is the sister hotel to the Colon, which is right next door - and far better value for money, with friendlier staff. In the Regencia Colon - if your spanish you will get served straight away, if not, expect to be ignored whilst the locals are served before you. The hotel rooms are tired and the heat in the rooms is far to hot, air conditioning is switched off in the winter months so you have to leave the windows open, which makes for a very noisy nights sleep. We have stayed several times in Barcelona and love the place. I would strongly recommend the Apsis Atrium Palace Hotel - great hotel with very friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: bori
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after reading the reviews posted here. And we have to stay that we loved our stay!!! The hotel is located close to the Cathedral and walking distance to most of the major attractions (Picasso Museum, Las Ramblas, Boqueria Market) and the Metro Station(Juame). The hotel staff is very friendly. Our room was very comfortable and above all clean. We would definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: craiggsx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of november after reading the reviews, I payed €100 per night for a double room and it was excellent value. The staff are very helpfull, the rooms clean and bright with good bathrooms, mini bar which is not too over priced, LCD TV and air con. The pix of the front of the hotel is a little deceptive, it actually faces buildings all round so ask for a room on the 5th floor or higher to get the bet of natural light, but the lack of real view is the only draw back with this hotel. The hotel is less than 100 meters from the Cathedral square which is lively at night with street theatre and music which you can watch from a table outside one of the tapas bars, great. I found no problems with noise, again a room at high level may have helped with this. The location is very very good, all the streets around the Gothic area lead back to the Cathedral square. I will definately stay here again and the sooner the better.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sasrah
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews here. It IS a great location. The staff ARE very helpful. Frankly we had no problem with the noise. We did not hear anything out of the ordinary for a city hotel room. One thing that is not mentioned on the hotel web site and I did not see in any of the reviews is that the hotel has an agreement with the parking lot right near the cathedral. So instead of costing us close to 30 euros a day it cost us 16 euros a day and if we had wanted to we could have had an access card which let us leave and enter the parking lot as we wanted during our stay. We did not use the car in the city as public transport here was very easy to use and convenient. The only thing I disliked was the double bed being 2 twins pushed together. But that is fairly common and expected so not really a real issue. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: KellyC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regencia Colon in August 2006 at the recommendation of a friend. The location was absolutely perfect. We could walk nearly everywhere and there is a taxi stand within 1 minute of the hotel. We had the triple room shown in the hotel photos section. It was exactly like it appears. The wall not shown is a large built in cabinet with a closet, many drawers and a flat screen tv. The room was very spacious for three people. And the bathroom was very nice and was one of the few in Europe that I did not manage to flood. I did not feel that the noise was too much. I slept very well and was never woken from noise on the street. The staff was very helpful and provided us with extra towels when asked, helped with a cab to the airport and recommendations and directions around town. Would definitely stay here again when in Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location. Great hotel. Lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: Cavill-Kotey
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Regencia Colon for 7 nights at the end of August. The location is fantastic, right in the centre of the Gothic Quarter and within 10 minutes walk to Placa de Catalunya, Las Ramblas and the habour. The nearest metro station (Jaume 1) is just a few minutes walk away. We had a huge double room which was newly decorated and had a fridge and a safe. We were in a corner room and had a view of the Le Seu cathedral from one of our bedroom windows. The en-suite bath/shower room was very clean and we couldn't have asked for better. The room was air-conditioned with a TV, radio, telephone and mini-bar. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful in every way. We had breakfast in the hotel just one morning. The choice available was good and was set out as a buffet so you could eat as much as you liked, but at 10euro per person we couldn't eat enough to warrant the cost and went to one of the many nearby cafes for a croissant instead. There's lots of good places to eat in close proximity to the hotel and a great food market (Mercat de la Boqueria) on the Ramblas selling plenty of fresh fruit. As several other reviewers have mentioned there is noise from the surrounding areas, but if you've ever lived in a busy town/city centre then this is to be expected. On the positive side, double glazed windows were being fitted just as we left so it should be less of an issue for future visitors. I'll definitely stay in this hotel again next time I visit Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, a little noisy.”
Reviews.Author: 1love2travel
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Regencia Colon for 3 nights at the end of July. While the location of this hotel definitely can't be beat, I do have to agree with other reviews in that it was pretty noisy when you wanted to sleep and I am definitely not a light sleeper. Besides the church bell going off at random times, there was some sort of orchestra band that played outside the cathedral first thing Sunday morning. Not so pleasant when we had all been out very late the night before. The rooms itself were very clean and simple but also a little outdated. They did have a small fridge and a safe in the room though which was very convenient. You have to hand in your keys to the front desk everytime you leave the room and ask for them when you return which was fine since there was always someone there. It's about a 10 mins walk up to the Aerobus bus stop that takes you to the airport. There is a really great restaurant that serves tapas on a stick next to a ice cream shop in the square outside the church. I definitely recommend that, and the ice cream isn't bad either. Pans Bread is also right around the corner and great for breakfast. The Hop on/Hop off bus is probably the best way to see all the sites of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Harm-and-Sharon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in the Gothic quarter. It is very near to metro station Jaume and in about 10 minutes you can walk to Placa Catalunya, the Ramblas and the harbour. The rooms in the hotel are oké: clean, spacious and airconditioned. The staff is very friendly and the breakfast is simple, but ok. From the airport you can take the Airbus (leaves in front of the airport next to the taxi's each 10-15 minutes) which brings you to Placa Catalunya for only € 3,50 (single trip). From there it's a 10 minute walk to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bring earplugs, but otherwise pretty great!”
Reviews.Author: OutAndAboutFromSF
Reviews.Content: I can't compare this hotel to others in Barcelona, but I *can* say that since I was mentally prepared for the noise and knew I'd need to sleep with earplugs, I was VERY happy with my stay in all other respects. My favorite things: - The front-desk staff were always very helpful and pleasant. Since I had major jet lag, I can confirm that they were helpful at all hours: day, evening, 2 in the morning, and even 6 in the morning. - The room! I got the absolutely cutest room up on the 5th floor, tucked into a corner, obviously modernized within the past few years and with every touch exactly as I would have designed it. Little stuff that might not sound like it makes much of a difference: A light in the closet! Warm-colored (instead of white) walls! Enough hangers! A built-in stand for your suitcase with trim on the back that helps you keep from dinging up the wall! Extra switches for all the lights next to the bed! A fridge that you can put your stuff in without breaking a seal that brings the Mini-Bar Charge Police! Good, light-blocking shutters! Yummy coconut-scented shampoo & lotion freebies instead of some gross perfume-y smell! And best of all, a satisfying shower that has enough door on it that you don't end up spraying the whole room! - The cleanliness. I couldn't find anything to quibble with, and there were little signs everywhere that the cleaning lady had been there. It's a small enough hotel that there may be one person who does the cleaning, and she seems to take pride in her work. - Location. Really perfect. - Yeah, the breakfast is a bit pricey, but it's also very complete and good, with fresh Spanish cheese and fresh orange slices along with all the usual cereal/toast/coffee/tea stuff. On your first day, it's a perfectly reasonable way to get off to a good start. It's hard to think of any negatives, although if you feel strange sleeping with earplugs in you'll definitely want to stay somewhere else. The only thing I can think of is that although Spain's new anti-smoking law is most definitely respected and enforced, if I left the bathroom window open some second-hand smoke came in that way (maybe from an employee break room below?). I paid just BARELY into the triple digits per night, and I must say I think I got my money's-worth.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at the Regencia Colon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I visited Barcelona Late December/Early January this year. I had a great time at the Regencia Colon, and I could not have asked for a more perfect location. Its right in the heart of the city off Las Ramblas, but it is off of a side street so you don't have the noise or sketchiness of Las Ramblas at night. I found the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms were also a good size. For the price, I don't think you could do any better.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great either”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights last week. Overall, we thought the hotel was fine. The room was large, with a telelvision, safe, large bathroom with plenty of hot water, and it was clean. The hotel staff were very nice to us, but they were nicer to my wife than to me. They did offer many recommendations for dinner (some were very good, some were terrible), and helped us with taxis and show reservations. The biggest problem with this hotel is the noise. There is the ringing of the cathedral bells all night (once every 15 minutes then 1-12 times on the hour, depending on the time). Then, there are all of the people out late at night, which is fine. But, for some reason, construction would begin at 5:00am and deliveries and garbage collection happened throughout the night. Also, the walls are very thin, and we could hear the man in the room next to us snoring all night. Some have written to request a room off the street because it may be quieter. We thought about that and inquired after we had spent our first night - but there are no rooms off the street. The hotel is in a terrific location. You are in walking distance from just about everything (or at least close to the subway). However, it would take a lot for me to go back there. I'd rather try somewhere new when I go back to Barcelona. Unfortunately, we were there during a large conference in the city, which cause room-rates to shoot up city-wide. This was one of the few places we could afford.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, noisey and needs more friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: tg49ers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel late February 2006 and thought I'd give a review of it. The location is definately the biggest plus of this hotel. It is one block away from the Cathedral, when you come out of the hotel you walk about 5 mins (towards the right) and you are in the La Ramblas area, which is quite the happening strip at all hours of the morning. The subway is nearby and really the best way to get around town. There are a few markets nearby and well as many nice restaurants. The rooms were very clean and well kept. there is a safe in the closet, so you can keep your valuables in it. There is a small TV in the room but has a few english channels. We had a room facing the street and it was extremely noisey at night. I found it abit weird having to give the hotel staff our hotel key when we left but nothing was taken from our room, so it is just a safety thing. I found the front desk staff to be a little unfriendly, maybe they need to hire some friendly smiling females instead of having nothing but 45-55 year old men working the front desk! Anyway, I did not have to deal with them too much other than asking them for a cab and enquiring about trying to stay an extra night (I booked off the website but needed an extra day, so they gave me a rate of 80E for another night, two single beds). Overall, the location was great, with average quality rooms, what brought down my rating was the noise and unfriendly male staff! I would stay again if i got a good rate, but I would request a room not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location BUT noisy at night!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading reviews on the site. We spent 4 nights at the hotel and were delighted with our choice until bedtime came! There was noise from delivery lorries and bin lorries all night and the Cathedral bell sounded throughout the night so you always knew the time! Double glazing would need to be installed before we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Great rooms but slightly noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in January this year. We booked it having read the excellent reviews on Trip Advisor. We paid with bancotel vouchers which made it cheaper than normal prices. We took an airport bus to Placa de Catalunya and then walked for about 5 minutes to find the hotel. On arrival at the hotel the staff spoke English to us which was helpful because we can't speak a word of Spanish. Our double room was excellent. It had laminate flooring, modern decor and a small but nice sparkling white bathroom with loads of free toiletries and fresh towels which were all replaced every day when the room was cleaned. There was a minibar and even a TV. The only problem was CNN and Eurosport were the only English channels it had! It was a bit of a pain having to hand your room key into reception every time you left the hotel and then asking for it on return. (?for security- unsure why). The location of the hotel was great for La Ramblas and the Gothic Quarter, with loads of nice tapas bars and restaurants if you look further than the typical touristy places. We were recommended to go "Taller del Tapas" restaurant nearby the hotel - it was not good. The staff made several mistakes with our order and then tried to charge us for food we never had and were quite rude when we questioned them. The food was very poor value for money compared to many traditional tapas places we went to. AVOID THIS ONE! Night time was a bit noisy because (as already mentioned by many others) the hotel is on a busy side street where dustbin lorries and other working traffic continue all night. It also seems to be a walk through for a few drunken shouting people at 3am. We knew it was 3am because you can also hear the cathedral clock chiming! However, it was a very minor problem and certainly has not put us off wanting to return here again. Barcelona is a brilliant city and this hotel made our stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel - shame about the noise”
Reviews.Author: robinjs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the regencia colon for 3 nights from 26th december. We were very impressed with the room size and the cleanliness. The location was perfect, close to the turistic bus stop and many good restaurants and only a 5 minute walk from Port Vell. We ate good tapas at Taverna del Bisbe right across the square from the hotel. We had breakfast at Neyras just around the corner (good eggs & bacon for 4 euros). Unfortunately every night the lorry noise from the street kept us awake. We would recommend going to Taller de Tapas on C.de l'Argenteria. The atmosphere is great and the tapas is outstanding but avoid the giant prawns which were overpriced and not well prepared. If we could be assured that there would be less traffic noise we would certainly return as the hotel was very comfortable and the staff very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Barcelona for 8 days, away for 4 then back for 3 and stayed here both visits. The location can't be beat, the rooms are small but immaculate and the staff were wonderful to us. I took the airport bus in to town and it was a 5 minute walk from Plaza Catalunya to the hotel. There were many good restaurants close by, subway and bus connections were great, shopping was wonderful. We like to eat vegetarian and would highly recommend Juicy Jones and Organic. Both are a 5 to 10 minute walk from the hotel. Most mornings I would walk to a bakery about a block away and bring pasteries and drinks back to the room. We were able to leave excess baggage at the hotel when we were out of town for a few days. That was a real bonus. We took the city bus tours the first day, both red and blue, and it really helped us get our bearings. You get a coupon book for discounts at many attractions and we made good use of it. In the evening we would walk down to the water, along the walkway to the beaches and have a drink at the beach cafes. It was wonderful. Look for concerts in the churches in the evening. Barcelona is a fabulous city and I would recommed this hotel to anyone visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location at the Regencia Colon”
Reviews.Author: jeanEssex
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night break at the Regencia Colon. I booked this hotel solely on the advice I read from the Tripadvisor website. As I have said in a review for another hotel I would not book a hotel room without consulting this website. You really cannot go wrong, you know exactly what you are going to get so you can make an informed choice. The Regencia is a three star hotel and is everything that a three star should be. It is clean and comfortable. We were given a rather large room (no. 560) on the fifth floor. This contained three beds, although only two of us travelling. The bathroom was very clean and with plenty of toiletries supplied. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom. There is a mini fridge but please bring your own kettle if you like a cuppa in the morning! The location as has been said in other reviews could not be bettered. It is situated directly behind it's 4 star sister hotel the Colon. Our room overlooked the Cathedral Square which is "the place" to be. Within two minutes walking distance of the Ramblas and about 5 mins from Port Vell. All in all a good stay. We booked the Bus Touristic for two days as this is the official Barcelona tour bus and stops at all the major sights. You can get on and off the bus as many times as you like. Yes you do have to keep an eye on your belongings as you should do anywhere but I never felt there were any problems. The Ramblas is a great place to walk day or evening just to see the fabulous and inspired mime artists, when you go you will see what I mean. The one downside for me was that there appears to be a real lack of decent restaurants. The fashion at the moment is tapas bars and there are simply hundreds of them. So can't say I enjoyed a really good meal. A tip though is to eat and drink along one of the side streets from the Ramblas or in the Cathedral Square. The Ramblas tapas bars seem to charge sky high prices because they are in such a popular location. That said, enjoy your stay at the Regencia Colon, it is a very good base.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, comfortable hotel close to the sights”
Reviews.Author: JW-ACE
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regencia Colon for 3 nights in mid-October. The room was a good size, very clean and comfortable. Excellent en-suite facilities. Room had sitting area with two easy chairs and coffee table. A good hot and cold buffet breakfast is available (10 euros)in the hotel, but there is also an excellent cafe bar just around the corner where you can get bacon and eggs for 3.75 euros. Building work is still going on just across the road (our room looked onto the site) but, unless you want to sleep late, this should not cause problems as work did not start until 8 am and was finished by 6.30 pm. Would certainly use this hotel again - it was a great location. In a quiet street, away from noisy main roads and passing tourists, yet just around the corner from the Cathedral and within easy walking distance of Port Vell, Catalunya Square and the Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights after our cruise. The location is great! The breakfast buffet was good...be sure and try the orange juice. The only complaint would be the noise from the street. Between people partying and truck deliveries being made...we did not get a good night's sleep either night. If they installed better windows w/some soundproofing, then our stay would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: leighuf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Regencia Colon Oct. 21, 2005 precruise. We paid $153 for a regular double sized room. LOCATION: Perfect! located in the barri gothic quarter directly across from the Cathedral. Within walking distance to La Ramblas. Bus Touristic has a stop nearby also. Several restaurants across the street, including Cafe Bisbe which I give high marks. Pharmacy also nearby (and a Starbucks, but I refused to even consider that!) ROOM: Small, typical European. Two twins pushed together in our double room. Bath was small, compact with a narrow shower/tub combo and toilet & bidet. Dental kit, shampoo, bath milk, soaps etc provided. Room had an AC themometer but it didn't work, so no AC. Room was very warm during the day, but we opened the window at night which cooled our room to a comfortable level. Room was furnished appropriately but nothing to write home about. LOBBY/FRONT DESK: The daytime front desk workers were not the most pleasant individuals, but they did speak English. The nighttime desk worker was very funny and very helpful. The elevator is very small and has a manual door. We were allowed to store our luggage during our check out day in the lobby. BARCELONA: Don't miss Sagrada Familia, the cathedral, and walking down La Ramblas to the port. We also did the Frommers walking tour in the Gothic quater. We really enjoyed our days in Barcelona precruise, but beware of the pickpockets (women begging with babies or anyone who attempts to pin a flower on your shirt!) OVERALL- hotel was fine for our needs- a place to rest our head after a transatlantic flight and a day full of sightseeing. We didn't spend much time in the room. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “superb location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 days at Barcelona - fantastic - the hotel could not have been more centrally located - all of the main sights/locations within walking distance, never used metro once (although I was told that it was easy to use and efficient), always felt safe. Room was clean, well fitted out (bed a bit hard!) and more than adequate - staff very friendly and helpful. Could not fault this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value-for-money & location”
Reviews.Author: leftfoot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a 5 day trip and the hotel was excellent. Good size, clean, airy and comfortable room, very friendly staff, a great location, and very reasonably priced (85EUR per room per night, 90EUR on Fri and Sat), made for a very enjoyable stay. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Honest hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeandWilla
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel but due to lack of rooms they moved me to their more expensive Hotel Colon 50 yards up the street.
